ZJerNud7yQI.title: The Dunkirk Halt Order: An Alternative Hypothesis
ZJerNud7yQI.description:
The debate continues over why the German Panzer Divisions were ordered to halt outside Dunkirk, allowing the British Expeditionary Force (BEF) to evacuate from Dunkirk. The Halt Order has been viewed as one of the "most critical mistakes" of the war... and yet, the jury is out on the reasons behind it. Was the Halt Order issued without clear reasoning? Or has the reason simply eluded us because we weren't looking at the bigger picture? Let's find out.

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

⏲️ Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

📚 BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES 📚

Atkin, R. “Pillar of Fire: Dunkirk, 1940.” Thistle Publishing,  Kindle 2013.
Forczyk, R. “Case Red: The Collapse of France.” Ospery Publishing, Kindle, 2017.
Fritz, S. “Ostkrieg: Hitler’s War of Extermination in the East.” University Press of Kentucky. 2011.
Halder, F. “The Halder War Diary 1939-1942.” Presidio Press, 1988.
Harris, J. & Wilbourn, R. “Rudolf Hess: Truth at Last.” Uniform Publishing Group LLP, Kindle 2019.
Guderian, H. “Panzer Leader.” Penguin Books, 2000.
Kershaw, I. “Fateful Choices: Ten Decisions that Changed the World, 1940-41..” Penguin Books, Kindle 2008.
Moorhouse, R. "The Devil's Alliance: Hitler's Pact with Stalin, 1939-1941." Random House Group, Ebook (Google Play) 2014.
Ricks, T. “Churchill & Orwell: The Fight for Freedom.” Duckworth Overlook, 2017.
Sebag-Montefiore, H. “Dunkirk: Fight to the Last Man.” Penguin Books, Kindle 2007.
Shirer, W. “The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich.” Pan Books, 1964.

Military History Visualized. "Why did Hitler halt the Advance on Dunkirk?" https://youtu.be/Q95__gXJ9l0
Military History not Visualized. "Did Hitler spare the British at Dunkirk?" https://youtu.be/k9XotaSS9TY
“Sir Oswald Mosley Interviewed on Thames Television in 1975.” https://youtu.be/frxbbUztJlY (timestamp 03:00)
Hitler, A. “The political testament of Adolf Hitler.” https://www.slideshare.net/PeterPieters1/the-political-testament-of-adolf-hitler

Full list of all my sources: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

ph9Ev0tG2uo.title: The Final BLITZKRIEG before Stalingrad City! BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E13
ph9Ev0tG2uo.description:
Hermann Hoth finally gets his 4th Panzer Army on the move, in what will turn out to be the final successful Blitzkrieg of the Stalingrad Campaign. The 48th Panzer Corps smashed through the 126th Rifle Division and raced off towards Stalingrad, causing chaos in the 64th Army. Shumilov reacts by pulling back his tanks, but the 64th Army is taken by surprise and is out of position. Eremenko must accept the inevitable - that his line is broken and that the city of Stalingrad is probably about to fall.

(This was formerly S5/E13)

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

gP0WxmqDg5s.title: Friedrich Kellner - A Social Democrat Living in the Third Reich
gP0WxmqDg5s.description:
Friedrich Kellner was a German Social Democrat who found himself living in the Third Reich during WW2. Recently, his diaries were published in a book called "My Opposition" (which I highly recommend you get if you're interested). In this video, we take a brief look into these diary entries, with a focus on the food and oil crisis that was going on at the time, and see if this tallies up with other sources (like Goebbel's Diaries, and Götz Aly's "Hitler's Beneficiaries"). Kellner gives us enough evidence to confirm many of the theories already presented on this channel - you can find the video links below.

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

⏲️ Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

DEAR YOUTUBE CENSOR - the purpose of this HISTORY documentary video is to educate people so that we can hopefully avoid repeating the mistakes that previous generations have made. I'm not a Nazi, nor am I promoting Hitler's evil ideology - in fact, this video exposes how terrible National Socialism actually was. The video is also backed by the sources listed below. So please reconsider before preventing people from seeing it. Thank you for reading.

- - - - -

📚 BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES 📚

Breggin, P. "Psychiatry's Role in the Holocaust." Elsevier Science Publishers, PDF 1993.
Colingham, L. "The Taste of War: World War Two and the Battle for Food." Penguin UK, 2011.
Edgerton, D. "Controlling Resources: Coal, Iron ore and Oil in the Second World War." Pdf.
Goebbels, J. “The Goebbels Diaries: 1939-1941.” Translated by Fred Taylor. Sphere Books LTD 1983.
Goebbels, J. “The Goebbels Diaries: 1942-1943.” Greenwood Press, Lochner Translation, 1970 (original 1948).
Harrison, M. "The Economics of World War II: Six Great Powers in International Comparison." Cambridge University Press, Kindle 2005.
Hitler, A. "Mein Kampf." Jaico Publishing House, 2017.
Kellner, F. "My Opposition: The Diary of Friedrich Kellner, A German against the Third Reich." Cambridge University Press, 2020.
Reimann, G. “The Vampire Economy: Doing Business under Fascism.” Kindle, Mises Institute, 2007. Originally written in 1939.
Tooze, A. “Wages of Destruction: The Making & Breaking of The Nazi Economy.” Penguin Books, 2007.
Toprani, A. "Oil and Grand Strategy: Great Britain and Germany, 1918-1941." Georgetown University, 2012. Dissertation, Pdf.
Toprani, A. "The First War for Oil: The Caucasus, German Strategy, and the Turning Point of the War on the Eastern Front, 1942." The Journal of Military History 80 (July 2016): 815-854.

Full list of all my sources https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

-zwq1w9BV2g.title: Dear Nigel Askey - Your Article about me is WRONG
-zwq1w9BV2g.description:
In 2017, historian Nigel Askey wrote an article "refuting" me and two of my videos. So, here is my rebuttal of his article. Because of the views expressed in his article, many have concluded that I "deliberately" "distort history" and am just plain "wrong" since a "published" historian said so. Apparently, they ALL believe the propaganda that the German Wehrmacht soldiers of WW2 were super-human-wonder-warriors FROM SPACE. Well, I hope those who practice r/BadHistory are watching this and are learning that their Wehraboo and Tankie/Socialist narrative doesn't hold up to scrutiny.

This video was edited by Terri Young! Need a Graphic Designer? Check out her website here: https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

- - - - -

📚 BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES 📚

Nigel Askey's Article about me and my videos (PDF): https://www.operationbarbarossa.net/an-essay-on-why-i-believe-a-tik-u-tube-presentation-is-incorrect-in-regards-to-losses-and-strengths-on-the-east-front/
Another copy of the Article: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cBsVCyn41V8BzkM9EZYSOSrGQ4TtR1OG/view?usp=sharing

Askey, N. "Why the presentation ‘The Numbers Say it All: The Myth of German Superiority on the WW2 Eastern Front’ is misleading." PDF Article 2017.
Dupuy, T. "Numbers, Predictions & War: Using History to Evaluate Combat Factors and Predict the Outcome of Battles." Bobbs-Merril Company, 1979.
Evans, R. “In Defence of History.” Granta Books, Kindle.
Glantz, D. & House, J. “When Titan’s Clashed.” University Press of Kansas, 2015.
Halder, F. “The Halder War Diary 1939-1942.” Presidio Press, 1988.
Liedtke, G. “Enduring the Whirlwind: The German Army and the Russo-German War 1941-1943.” Helion & Company LTD, 2016.
Lopukhovsky, L. & Kavalerchik, B. "The Price of Victory: The Red Army's Casualties in the Great Patriotic War." Pen & Sword Military, Kindle 2017.
Mises, L. "Theory and History: An Interpretation of Social and Economic Evolution." Liberty Fund, 2005. (Original 1957.)
Newton, S. "German Battle Tactics on the Russian Front 1941-1945." Schiffer Publishing Ltd, 1994.

TIK, “The Numbers Say it All | The Myth of German Superiority on the WW2 Eastern Front,” https://youtu.be/_7BE8CsM9ds
Shostak, F. “Forecasting: The Model Solution,” https://mises.org/library/forecasting-model-solution

Full list of all my sources https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

nMiau19ubIo.title: Nationalism DOESN’T explain WHY Austria-Hungary collapsed
nMiau19ubIo.description:
The go-to answer is that national or ethnic divisions caused the collapse of the Austro-Hungarian Empire. But is this really the case? Using multiple sources, it's time to provide YouTube with a narrative which doesn't confirm nationalist beliefs. The Habsburgs survived the collapse, with Emperor Karl / Charles trying to reclaim his throne later on before being exiled. However, by about mid-November 1918, he had lost all power. The fact that there is no specific date when Austria-Hungary collapsed, and the fact that the 'national revolutions' were met with relatively little opposition, speaks volumes. As does the fact that the new states were all multinational, which undermines the narrative that nationalism was the reason why Austria-Hungary collapsed. Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

⏲️ Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

Macgregor, J. & Docherty, G. “Prolonging the Agony: How the Anglo-American Establishment Deliberately Extended WW1 by Three-and-a-Half Years.” Trine Day LLC, 2018.
Marx, K. “Capital: A Critique of Political Economy: Volume III.” PDF, English edition, 2010. (Originally written 1894)

Oxford Dictionary of English, Oxford University Press, Third Edition 2010.

iqK0MBfxlyo.title: The Chetniks of WW2 Yugoslavia - Resistance or Axis Collaborators?
iqK0MBfxlyo.description:
Were the Chetniks Axis collaborators? Or did they resist the Axis during WW2? Time to explore this debate by exploring the situation in Yugoslavia during the war, and examining the Yugoslavian resistance, with a focus on Mihailović's Chetniks. We can compare them to other Chetnik movements as well as to Tito's Communist 'Partisans' and see if we can figure out what the historical truth really is.

Today's question was asked by Habrsoa. To ask your own question, please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. oT2NPAoXeSk.title: “Send us Wheat or Coffins” | The Axis Occupation of Greece WW2
oT2NPAoXeSk.description:
This documentary describes some of the horrors that the Greek people went through under German (National Socialist), Italian (Fascist) and Bulgarian rule, covering mainland Greece (specifically Athens), the islands of Syros, Cephalonia (Kefalonia) and Kalymnos, amongst others. Greece was occupied by the Axis powers in April 1941 and suffered terribly in the subsequent years, with their economy plundered, their people starved by famine (known as the 'Great Famine' or 'Μεγάλος Λιμός' in Greek), the Jews of Salonika shipped off to Auschwitz as part of the Holocaust, and their currency (the drachma) hyperinflated into oblivion. It's no wonder a resistance movement sprang up, and that Greece ended up in a Civil War that lasted (on and off) until 1949. This video was created in the hope that we can learn from history and prevent such a tragedy from happening again. Never forget.

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

⏲️ Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

Farrell, N. "Mussolini: A New Life." Endeavour Press Ltd, Kinde 2015.

localized.title: “Send us Wheat or Coffins” | The Axis Occupation of Greece WW2
localized.description:
This documentary describes some of the horrors that the Greek people went through under German (National Socialist), Italian (Fascist) and Bulgarian rule, covering mainland Greece (specifically Athens), the islands of Syros, Cephalonia (Kefalonia) and Kalymnos, amongst others. Greece was occupied by the Axis powers in April 1941 and suffered terribly in the subsequent years, with their economy plundered, their people starved by famine (known as the 'Great Famine' or 'Μεγάλος Λιμός' in Greek), the Jews of Salonika shipped off to Auschwitz as part of the Holocaust, and their currency (the drachma) hyperinflated into oblivion. It's no wonder a resistance movement sprang up, and that Greece ended up in a Civil War that lasted (on and off) until 1949. This video was created in the hope that we can learn from history and prevent such a tragedy from happening again. Never forget.

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

⏲️ Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

rK0SuYi4Hho.title: Paulus HAD to take Stalingrad (he couldn't bypass it)
rK0SuYi4Hho.description:
It has been argued that Paulus should have bypassed Stalingrad, block the Volga to the south of the city, then ride off to Astrakhan. However, the evidence weights heavily against this. In this video, we build upon our discussions from last week ( Battlestorm Stalingrad S4/E12 https://youtu.be/V87miKech6I ) and, using YOUR amazing comments, we discuss the logistical situation, the alternative tactics and strategies that the 6th Army could have taken during the Stalingrad campaign, and see if there was any alternative to Paulus going into the city of Stalingrad. Overall, it appears that Paulus HAD to take Stalingrad. But if you disagree, let me know!

V87miKech6I.title: Was Reaching the Volga North of Stalingrad the WRONG move? BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E12
V87miKech6I.description:
This is a battle-animation documentary covering the events of the Stalingrad Campaign on the 26th and 27th of August 1942, backed by over 100 sources, and multiple in-video references. And, after seeing how bad the situation is for Gustav Anton von Wietersheim's 14th Panzer Corps is, we will ask the question: Was reaching the Volga north of Stalingrad the wrong move? Could Paulus's 6th Army have gone southeast to meet with Hoths 4th Panzer Army? Be sure to give me your thoughts in the comments below!

(This was formerly S4/E12)

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

⏲️ Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

⚔️ If you like Stalingrad, you may also enjoy historian Anton Joly's YouTube channel "Stalingrad Battle Data". Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIk1QDvITjPOCsIRGGpSasA

Looking for a Graphic Designer? Here's one who helped make the graphics for this video: https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

If you'd like to learn more about the 64th Army, check out Dann Falk's book on the 64th Army, and his website here: https://falkenbooks.com/

VsLW7VrOpA8.title: David Irving - Can you trust ANYTHING he wrote?
VsLW7VrOpA8.description:
Can you trust ANYTHING that David Irving wrote? In 1996, David Irving sued Deborah Lipstadt for libel (in the "Irving vs Penguin Books Ltd" trial) because Deborah Lipstadt had said Irving was a Holocaust Denier. Historian Richard Evans was called upon as an expert witness, and he examined Irving's works for two years, discovering many major factual errors in David Irving's works. Richard Evans came to the conclusion that Irving cannot even be classed as a 'historian', and says "not one sentence" in any of his speeches or written works can be trusted. Richard Evan's "Telling Lies About Hitler" presents a solid case against David Irving that casts serious doubt about every 'historical' text that Irving wrote, and this video presents 3 examples from Evan's brilliant book (this video is not a sponsored video, I genuinely think Evan's book is brilliant and you should get yourself a copy) that really should make you question the opinions of those who still promote Irving's works.

Holocaust deniers may continue to deny that the 'Final Solution to the Jewish Question' took place, but in actively distorting the evidence, they undermine their own cause. The term 'distorian' describes their 'writers' better than the term 'historian'.

And, in case it isn't blatantly obvious, I'm NOT a Fascist, NOT a Nazi, NOT a Marxist, and am NOT promoting said evil ideologies. This video is for educational and historical purposes, so that we may learn from the past and prevent it from repeating.

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

⏲️ Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

📚 BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES 📚

Evans, R. “In Defence of History.” Granta Books, Kindle.
Evans, R. "Telling Lies About Hitler: The Holocaust, History and the David Irving Trial." Verso, 2002.
Irving, D. "Hitler's War:1939-1942." PAPERMAC 1983.
Irving, D. "Hitler's War:1942-1945." PAPERMAC 1983.
Lipstadt, D. "Denying the Holocaust: The Growing Assault on Truth and Memory." Penguin Books, 2016.
Rees, L. "The Holocaust: A New History." Penguin Books, 2017.
Seidel, G. "The Holocaust Denial: Antisemitism, Racism, & the New Right." Beyond the Pale Collective, 1986.
Shermer, M. Grobman, A. "Denying History: Who Says the Holocaust Never Happened and Why Do They Say It?" University of California Press, 2009.
Steinbacher, S. "Auschwitz: A History." Penguin Books, 2005.

The FULL list of all my sources: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

QevMycFrWRM.title: Was the Gleiwitz Incident the SPARK that ignited WW2?
QevMycFrWRM.description:
The story of the Gleiwitz Incident in August 1939 (a false flag attack on the Gleiwitz radio station and towers) has often been said to have been the event that started the Second World War. But this story is suspicious to say the least. Alfred Naujocks is our main source of information, and claims that he was the man who started WW2. But he contradicts himself in his various accounts of what happened. We're not even sure what date it actually took place, or if it took place at all. So today we explore the Gleiwitz Incident and attempt to answer the question raised by my Patreon, Vinny Siracusa, as to whether it actually happened or not, or if it did, when. Was Alfred Naujocks REALLY the man who started WW2?

🔔 Subscribe for more History content: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCfZz8F37oSJ2rtcEJHM2kCg?sub_confirmation=1

kPu6Crjai4I.title: The Day the AXIS reached the Volga in 1942 - BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E10
kPu6Crjai4I.description:
Battle animation documentary of the day that Paulus's 6th Army reached the Volga, backed by over 100 sources, and multiple in-video references. The Soviet Red Army also scrambled to launch counterattacks against the Axis advance. More attacks came in against the northern Don flank where the Italians were defending, and Stalin and his generals were arguing among themselves. Yes, at this moment, there appeared to be no end in site for the war on the Eastern Front.

This is the 10th episode of TIK's ongoing documentary on Stalingrad - detailing the longest and toughest battle in history. If you're new here and want to see the first episode, click here - https://youtu.be/YAfo5mse-ag

(This was formerly S4/E10)

w941j12XUAs.title: Could Sweden have withstood a German Blitzkrieg in WW2?
w941j12XUAs.description:
Arguably, Sweden managed to remain "neutral" in WW2. But the Germans did develop a plan to invade them in 1943. So, Peter Cadier has asked - Why wasn't Sweden attacked in WW2? Was it because they were secretly aligned to the Axis? And could the Swedish military have withstood an attack if they had been?

Want to ask a question? Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. For $5 or more you can ask questions which I will answer in future Q&A videos. Thank you to my current Patrons! Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

Gilmour, J. “Sweden, the Swastika and Stalin: The Swedish Experience in the Second World War.” Edinburgh University Press, 2011.
Ziemke, E. “The German Northern Theatre of Operations: 1940-1945.” Pickle Partners Publishing, Kindle 2014 (original 1956).

UhBPWZD2LxM.title: The Battle of Tali-Ihantala 1944 | WW2 Battlestorm Documentary
UhBPWZD2LxM.description:
The Battle of Tali-Ihantala narrated with unit movements over a map, backed by sources (listed in the description).

In 1944 The Red Army of the Soviet Union attacked the Finnish Army on the VKT Line during the Continuation War, resulting in the Battle of Tali-Ihantala. Here are the major unit movements during the battle and a discussion regarding the statistics and the interpretation of the battle. #WW2 #ContinuationWar

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

Want to ask a question? Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. And (unfortunately) also wikipedia - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Tali-Ihantala

cPTc1HsoHA4.title: Finland's Continuation War in a Nutshell #WW2
cPTc1HsoHA4.description:
BlackJackSwagger asked – What the hell happened on the “Continuation War” front? I’d love to hear your take, in short, on what happened during that part of the (larger) conflict. How did Finland mount an offensive against the Soviet Union? Did they receive tactical/material assistance from Nazi Germany? How did they utilize that material and how did their standing military leadership interact or deal with their Allies during the conflict?

srajqdXQTf0.title: Why did 1st Panzer Army go into the Caucasus? Why not the Italian Alpini? And more... Stalingrad Q&A
srajqdXQTf0.description:
A couple of questions from my Patrons today -

Alexander Kerscher asked - why did the OKW use badly equipped troops of its Axis Allies to secure the flanks of the 6th Army while sending a Tank Army into the Mountains of the Caucasus?
 
And Christopher Scarpino asked - Did any of the German General Staff try to talk Hitler or Paulus out of going into Stalingrad?  Did anyone realize that (As I mentioned in my very long post) there are plenty of other places to cut the river traffic along the Volga (if that is all the Germans wanted to do)? Why did they lose focus on the true strategic goal: capturing Soviet oil for Germany and denying the (same) oil to the Soviets? How did they get so far off track?

- - - - -

Several questions and interesting comments from my recent Battlestorm Stalingrad series, including the question of what was the point of Landermann's 24th Panzer Corps having just one division in it? oZePFDn3GAI.title: Was there a Civil War in Italy 1943-45? TIK Q&A
oZePFDn3GAI.description:
Jim Land has asked - I vaguely know that after Sicily fell Italy was ready to throw in the towel and in some way switched sides.  I've even heard it described as a civil war in 43-45.  Can you elaborate on the details, or recommend books/lectures on the subject?

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

The two books I'd recommend on this topic are Farrell's "Mussolini: A New Life" and Holland's "Italy's Sorrow".

cZpuJwvuJvE.title: Battlestorm Stalingrad E8 - Chaos Eve
cZpuJwvuJvE.description:
The eve of the great attack on Stalingrad city itself is here! As Hoth struggles to get anywhere in the south, Paulus plans his attack on the city of Stalingrad. It appears the von Weichs is overstretched, Hitler is annoyed with his mountain troops in the Caucasus, and the Germah High Command are considering forming a Romanian Army Group. Meanwhile, Eremenko also attempts to form some sort of defensive line outside the city of Stalingrad, but his forces are shattered from the previous fighting. Luckily he has some Lend-Lease tanks from the USA to help him out...

(This was formerly S3/E8)

⭐ The next video in this series: https://youtu.be/IFccMvTj67I ⭐

If you like Stalingrad, you may also enjoy historian Anton Joly's YouTube channel "Stalingrad Battle Data". Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIk1QDvITjPOCsIRGGpSasA

odr8PcNpZ88.title: Amazon (UK) pressured into banning Mein Kampf and other historical Primary Sources
odr8PcNpZ88.description:
Recently, Amazon (UK) was pressured into banning certain historical texts - including Hitler's Mein Kampf, and Streicher's The Poisonous Mushroom. The pressure came from the Holocaust Educational Trust, which may have had the backing of British Politicians. Having resisted for years, Amazon finally gave in to the pressure. Let's discuss the implications of this banning of primary sources for the historical community.

I am NOT a Fascist, NOT a National Socialist, and NOT a Marxist Socialist. And I am NOT promoting such evil ideologies. This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

This video was edited by Terri Young https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

Articles used in the video -
https://uk.finance.yahoo.com/news/amazon-bans-sale-most-editions-151423879.html

https://www.expressandstar.com/news/politics/2020/01/24/mps-sign-holocaust-educational-trusts-book-of-commitment-in-parliament/

JzEK5yd2kLw.title: 1946: The Greatest Depression in US History (prior to 2020)
JzEK5yd2kLw.description:
Historians completely ignore the 1946 Great Depression, which was statistically worse than the Great Depression of 1929-1941*. The was a huge drop in GDP and GNP, and it's been getting worse every time the US government revises its official statistics. Today, we're going to cover the history of the Greatest Depression in US history (at least, prior to 2020, which might be worse).

*Actually 1929-1945, as you'll see if you watch the video fully.

Also, for those crying "Stick to Tanks", this is 100% about TANKS, as you'll see if you actually watch the video... (Did WW2 really get America out of the Depression?)

t71aD-nOkkk.title: Battlestorm Stalingrad E7 - Operation Nord
t71aD-nOkkk.description:
Before Paulus could strike towards Stalingrad, he had to clear the Bend of the Great Don River of Soviet forces. He therefore launched his forces northwards - in Operation Nord - aiming to defeat Kriuchenkin’s 4th Tank Army and capture bridgeheads across the Don. Today, we'll see these events unfold.

(This was formerly S3/E7)

⭐ The next video in this series: https://youtu.be/cZpuJwvuJvE ⭐

X3L0_pjRdcs.title: What Causes a Recession or Depression?
X3L0_pjRdcs.description:
What causes a recession or depression? - the answer may surprise you. The boom and bust cycle has been rolling on for centuries now, even though we know what causes it and have the means at our disposal to stop it. Fiat currency creation (fractional reserve banking) creates distortions in the market, made worse by interest rate policies and State interventions in the economy, that result in 'bubbles' of over-expansion. When the situation inevitably destabilizes, these bubbles pop, causing lots of people to lose their jobs. The solution is to stop printing currency, remove the shackles off the economy, and let the market actually do its job for once.

This video was edited by Terri Young https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES

While I did use several sources for this video, the main one I'd recommend is Murray Rothbard's "America's Great Depression" which explains the causes of recessions and depressions amazingly well.

For a book on basic economics, I'd recommend Hazlitt's "Economics in One Lesson", and after that Thomas Sowell's "Basic Economics".

Full list of all my sources https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

kPVo9w79D6w.title: Did the Soviet Union EVER Recover from WW2?
kPVo9w79D6w.description:
Mitchell Line has asked - what was the state of the Soviet Union after the end of the war and what did they do to begin repairing it? They were desperately low on man power after the war and much of their supplies were in the Urals. Did they move the factories back west as soon as possible and etc?

Well, after reading a couple of books recently that mentioned the fact that the Soviet Union hadn't recovered from WW2 by the mid-1960s, I decided to investigate further... So, let's answer both Mitchell's and my own question - when, or did, the Soviet Union EVER Recover from WW2?

Oh, and should I just 'Stick to Tanks'? https://youtu.be/FgyYkLqEyh8

This video was edited by Terri Young https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

geyvR1mCoOc.title: Goebbels on the German Food Crisis 1942-1943
geyvR1mCoOc.description:
Joseph Goebbels's diary entries give an interesting account of the food crisis going on in Germany during the mid-war years. The Third Reich lacked enough food to feed itself, which is part of the reason why Hitler had to go to war in the first place (see "The REAL Reason why Hitler HAD to go to War in WW2" https://youtu.be/PQGMjDQ-TJ8 for more information). Today I'm going to read several entries from Goebbels diary, provide some additional information, and continue to argue that Hitler had no choice but to start Operation Barbarossa in 1941.

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

This video was edited by Terri Young! https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

localized.title: Goebbels on the German Food Crisis 1942-1943
localized.description:
Joseph Goebbels's diary entries give an interesting account of the food crisis going on in Germany during the mid-war years. The Third Reich lacked enough food to feed itself, which is part of the reason why Hitler had to go to war in the first place (see "The REAL Reason why Hitler HAD to go to War in WW2" https://youtu.be/PQGMjDQ-TJ8 for more information). Today I'm going to read several entries from Goebbels diary, provide some additional information, and continue to argue that Hitler had no choice but to start Operation Barbarossa in 1941.

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

This video was edited by Terri Young! https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

jUUZFiWxWaM.title: Himmler's INSANE Reason for Recruiting non-Germans in the Waffen-SS
jUUZFiWxWaM.description:
My Patron - So long, John - is concerned that some people online are claiming that the Nazis were “just racially conscious" rather than full-on racist. These people argue that the Waffen-SS recruited non-Germans, which supposedly "proves" how "diverse" and "inclusive" the German Army was in WW2. Clearly, that view is total rubbish, as this video will make clear. And, in the process of answering this question, we'll discover just how INSANE Heinrich Himmler and Nazi ideology really were.

And it should be fairly obvious, but just to make sure everyone's fully aware - I am NOT a Fascist, NOT a National Socialist, and NOT a Marxist Socialist. And I am NOT promoting said ideologies. This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

eCkyWBPaTC8.title: Hitler's Socialism | Destroying the Denialist Counter Arguments
eCkyWBPaTC8.description:
"I am a socialist.” - Hitler, from his "Zweites Buch" (Second Book) Page 50.

Some continue to believe that Hitler and National Socialism wasn't REAL (National) Socialism. Some believe that the totalitarian State of the Third Reich had no power at all, and that the market was 'free'. They want to believe that Hitler and his State had NO control over the economy, and that the ideology of National Socialism didn't call for the creation of a 'People's State' after the conquest of Lebensraum. Yes, 80 years after the events in question, many are still pushing a contradictory narrative that directly goes against the colossal amount of evidence pointing towards the opposite conclusion, and then refuse to even consider the possibility that they might be wrong in their interpretation. Well today, we will walk through numerous primary and secondary sources, show the substantial amount of flaws in the denialist argument, and present a solid interpretation of the evidence that makes much more sense than the denialist argument ever has.

I am NOT a Fascist, NOT a National Socialist, and NOT a Marxist Socialist. And I am NOT promoting said ideologies. This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

This video was edited by Terri Young https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

The script for this video was 40,916 words. Feel free to download the PDF https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FYEe2xkJcOVQqgvgeFgDizlPbV54CrYN/view?usp=sharing

FgyYkLqEyh8.description:
Critics of mine are adamant that I know nothing outside of military history, and that me and my viewers don't deserve to debate topics that these critics deem 'above' us. Well, here's my response to such criticism.

Today's question was asked by Uncle Joe S (Stalin), who said "Why is more & more time being used for political speeches these days, instead of your superior military content that we love?"  Please don't say "It's to give context", the political content has kept growing, 95% of it does not give any meaningful context & it's starting to get out of hand.  Let's stay on point at TIK."

This video was edited by Terri Young https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

And yes, this video was uploaded on a Saturday, and there will be a much bigger video on Monday too. I do videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

B4_HLYP1-mc.title: I agree with Christer Bergström's "Operation Barbarossa: 9 popular myths busted" article
B4_HLYP1-mc.description:
My Patron, Björn Nord, asked if I could read an article ("Operation Barbarossa: 9 popular myths busted") written by Swedish Historian Christer Bergström and comment upon it. Here's the link to the article -
https://www.historyextra.com/period/second-world-war/operation-barbarossa-9-popular-myths-busted/ 

Points discussed -
1. Stalin’s collapse
2. Mass surrenders by Soviet soldiers
3. Master spy Sorge contributed to the alleged relocation of the Soviet Far East armies that are supposed to have saved Moscow
4. The wearing down of the Wehrmacht through relentless Soviet counter-attacks
5. The vast numerical superiority enjoyed by the Soviets
6. It was the Arctic cold that halted the German offensive
7. The vast differences in troop casualties between the two sides on the Eastern Front
8. The Soviet partisans
9. The unknown wave of mass rape on the Eastern Front

Let the wehraboo tears flow!

localized.title: I agree with Christer Bergström's "Operation Barbarossa: 9 popular myths busted" article
localized.description:
My Patron, Björn Nord, asked if I could read an article ("Operation Barbarossa: 9 popular myths busted") written by Swedish Historian Christer Bergström and comment upon it. Here's the link to the article -
https://www.historyextra.com/period/second-world-war/operation-barbarossa-9-popular-myths-busted/ 

Points discussed -
1. Stalin’s collapse
2. Mass surrenders by Soviet soldiers
3. Master spy Sorge contributed to the alleged relocation of the Soviet Far East armies that are supposed to have saved Moscow
4. The wearing down of the Wehrmacht through relentless Soviet counter-attacks
5. The vast numerical superiority enjoyed by the Soviets
6. It was the Arctic cold that halted the German offensive
7. The vast differences in troop casualties between the two sides on the Eastern Front
8. The Soviet partisans
9. The unknown wave of mass rape on the Eastern Front

Let the wehraboo tears flow!

FbF1QkHVnqU.title: "But what about the Panzer II !?" Stalingrad Addendum 3
FbF1QkHVnqU.description:
Several commenters expressed their dissatisfaction over my recent Battlestorm Stalingrad documentary where I said that half the Soviet tanks were light tanks, which gave the Germans an advantage. They said "ah ha!" and proceeded to accuse me of Soviet/Russian bias because I'd "forgotten" about the Panzer II. Well, it turns out I hadn't forgotten about the Panzer II at all. So today, I'm going to show you the numbers and confirm that, yes, the Germans did have the advantage in the August of 1942 when it came to their tank numbers during the battle of Stalingrad.

In the video I also discuss some other points that were raised, including the 255th Cavalry Regiment, my mispronunciation of Hoth, and Stalin's decision to not evacuate the city of Stalingrad.

If you like Stalingrad, you may also enjoy historian Anton Joly's YouTube channel "Stalingrad Battle Data". Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIk1QDvITjPOCsIRGGpSasA

VpO-hbCyBDk.title: Battlestorm Stalingrad E6 - The Kalach Cauldron
VpO-hbCyBDk.description:
Lopatin's 62nd Army is crushed inside the Kalach Pocket as Paulus's 6th Army devours what's left of Soviet resistance in the cauldron (German: Kessel). But, while the German Generals proclaim a great victory, the reality was slightly different... Also Eremenko plans the defense of the city of Stalingrad, with thousands of civilians obliged by the State to dig many miles of anti-tank ditches and fortifications. Will these be enough to stall the Wehrmacht advance? Will the Red Army recover from it's defeat? Let's find out.

(This was formerly S2/E6)

⭐ The next video in this series: https://youtu.be/t71aD-nOkkk ⭐

If you like Stalingrad, you may also enjoy historian Anton Joly's YouTube channel "Stalingrad Battle Data". Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIk1QDvITjPOCsIRGGpSasA

The detailed maps in this video were made by Graphic Designer Terri Young. (And, in this case, she also did some of the narration.) If you'd like a logo creating, or a new YouTube avatar, you can contact her on her website: https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

_mhPXyIEHzg.title: Soviet Infantry Small Arms Advantage Late in WW2? TIK Q&A
_mhPXyIEHzg.description:
Did Soviet troops have a huge advantage when it came to infantry equipment, and did they mow down the Germans with huge numbers of submachine guns? That's the question that Noremac Cameron has asked, and it's a good question! Let's see if we can figure it out.

1ayh2_1UZkU.title: BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E5 - Disaster at the Don
1ayh2_1UZkU.description:
62nd Army is in trouble as Paulus's 6th Army launches an operation to encircle it on the western bank of the Don. Can Lopatin or Gordov save the situation? And at the same time, 4th Panzer Army continues on its path towards Stalingrad from the south. Can Chuikov or Shumilov stop them? Let's find out.

(This was formerly S2/E5)

localized.title: BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E5 - Disaster at the Don
localized.description:
62nd Army is in trouble as Paulus's 6th Army launches an operation to encircle it on the western bank of the Don. Can Lopatin or Gordov save the situation? f3eOKrXmoPU.title: BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E4 | Hoth's Panzer Drive
f3eOKrXmoPU.description:
With Paulus's 6th Army stalled near Kalach, Hermann Hoth's 4th Panzer Army is ordered to strike towards Stalingrad. This move splits the Soviet 51st Army in two and forces the Soviets to improvise a southern defense of the region. As a result, Vasily Chuikov is given a new command - over the 64th Army's Southern Operational Group. Chuikov attempts to form a line as the chaos overwhelms the men of the 208th Rifle Division.

The script for this video was 4,461 words long.

(This was formerly S2/E4)

jwC-yoh9bew.title: A Complicated Question about Technology, and it's impact on History | Q&A
jwC-yoh9bew.description:
Today's question was asked by Clive Hamilton, who was worried that the consistent theme of technology caused chaotic surprises throughout history. He asked, was it reasonable for the French to have missed that tanks can travel through woods? And do I think this has echoes in the modern arena such as cyber warfare or AI or drones or space etc? Can you see any similarities where a conventionally so called weaker ideology, which they are in my view, can suddenly overpower democracy and it's game over in the modern world? What lessons can be learned from all of this?

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES

5M8wG2X0fGo.title: Deliberate or Desperate? Red Army Counterattacks of 1941 & 1942
5M8wG2X0fGo.description:
Thank you to Eric Zadravec for today's question! - Were the constant counter-attacks and counter-offensives conducted by the Red Army in 1941 and 1942 a deliberate strategy of attrition or merely the result of the Stavka overestimating the Red Army's abilities and a 'cult of the offensive' mindset? Were the large losses this offensive posture incurred on Soviet soldiers worth the effect they had on the Wehrmacht? Did Stalin play a large role in influencing this strategy or was this something ingrained in the Soviet high command's mindset and operational doctrine? And would a defensive posture, specifically in 1941, have better suited the Red Army or was buying time the best option for the USSR?

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES

Specific sources used -

Glantz, D. & House, J. “When Titan’s Clashed.” University Press of Kansas, 2015.
Fritz, S. “Ostkrieg: Hitler’s War of Extermination in the East.” University Press of Kentucky. 2011.
(David Stahel's books would be relevant too, although I didn't use them in the video.)

Full list of all my sources https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

- - - - -

Ydx72tT552k.title: Why did People vote for Hitler?
Ydx72tT552k.description:
According to some historians, Hitler offered only 'vague' promises to voters, and his ideology had no concrete policies. Yet somehow, a lot of people voted for Hitler. Well, why would they do that? There were plenty of other parties they could have chosen, so why did they vote for the one that offered them little or nothing? Today, we're going to take a look at what some historians say, and see if we can piece together exactly why the Germans voted for Hitler.

ATTENTION: I'm NOT a Nazi, nor a Fascist, nor a Marxist. And I am NOT promoting their ideologies. Instead, by giving people an accurate assessment of history, backed up by sources, we can learn from the past and prevent such disastrous totalitarian regimes from taking power again.

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

The graphics in this video were created by Terri Young. Check out her website here https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

- - - - -

BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES

Specific video sources -

localized.title: Why did People vote for Hitler?
localized.description:
According to some historians, Hitler offered only 'vague' promises to voters, and his ideology had no concrete policies. Yet somehow, a lot of people voted for Hitler. Well, why would they do that? There were plenty of other parties they could have chosen, so why did they vote for the one that offered them little or nothing? Today, we're going to take a look at what some historians say, and see if we can piece together exactly why the Germans voted for Hitler.

ATTENTION: I'm NOT a Nazi, nor a Fascist, nor a Marxist. And I am NOT promoting their ideologies. Instead, by giving people an accurate assessment of history, backed up by sources, we can learn from the past and prevent such disastrous totalitarian regimes from taking power again.

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

The graphics in this video were created by Terri Young. Check out her website here https://www.terriyoungdesigns.co.uk/

- - - - -

URBlC-wjXiQ.title: Why did Synthetic OIL not solve the AXIS OIL Crisis?
URBlC-wjXiQ.description:
The Axis suffered a colossal oil crisis in World War II. And today, we have two questions about this -

Kevin Dragos asked- How did coal-derived synthetic fuel affect Germany's overall fuel situation, and why could it apparently not sufficiently make up for the deficit of oil?

& Craig Walenta asked - At what point would German occupation of the Caucasus have materially impacted the Red Army's ability to fight the war?

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

U8LNFjFyGU8.title: Was Hitler a Strong or Weak Dictator? Intentionalist vs Functionalist/Structuralist Debate
U8LNFjFyGU8.description:
There was a huge debate between historians regarding whether Hitler was a Strong or Weak dictator. The Intentionalist historians said his dictatorship was strong, and that he gave orders that the divided and weak State carried out. And the Structuralist/Functionalist historians said that he was a weak dictator, and that the divided State structure was what actually drove the events that we saw happen during the Third Reich. Today, we're going to discuss this and see how this debate was 'solved', and how it might be time to dig it up again...

I'm not a Fascist or anything similar, nor am I promoting said ideologies. This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

Today's question comes from Guy Andrews - Hi Tik, in regards to the Nazi State and the inner-workings of the state itself, would you regard yourself as being an 'intentationalist' or a 'structuralist' in the historical debate?

If you would like to ask a question, please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. For $5 or more you can ask questions which I will answer in future Q&A videos. Thank you to my current Patrons! You're AWESOME! https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory or https://www.subscribestar.com/tikhistory

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

http://www.public.asu.edu/~acichope/FWA_Readings/Richard%20Bessel,%20Functionalists%20vs%20Intentionalists.pdf
https://www.holocaustcentre.org.nz/uploads/1/1/5/2/115245341/interpretations-of-the-holocaust.pdf

localized.description:
There was a huge debate between historians regarding whether Hitler was a Strong or Weak dictator. The Intentionalist historians said his dictatorship was strong, and that he gave orders that the divided and weak State carried out. And the Structuralist/Functionalist historians said that he was a weak dictator, and that the divided State structure was what actually drove the events that we saw happen during the Third Reich. Today, we're going to discuss this and see how this debate was 'solved', and how it might be time to dig it up again...

I'm not a Fascist or anything similar, nor am I promoting said ideologies. This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

Today's question comes from Guy Andrews - Hi Tik, in regards to the Nazi State and the inner-workings of the state itself, would you regard yourself as being an 'intentationalist' or a 'structuralist' in the historical debate?

If you would like to ask a question, please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. For $5 or more you can ask questions which I will answer in future Q&A videos. Thank you to my current Patrons! You're AWESOME! https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory or https://www.subscribestar.com/tikhistory

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

- - - - -

BIBLIOGRAPHY / SOURCES

Relevant Articles to this debate -

https://revisingtheholocaust.blogspot.com/2014/05/intentionalist-vs-structuralist-debate.html
http://shshistory.com/extra%20pages/AAAHitler;%20the%20intentionalist%20and%20functionalist.pdf
http://www.public.asu.edu/~acichope/FWA_Readings/Richard%20Bessel,%20Functionalists%20vs%20Intentionalists.pdf
https://www.holocaustcentre.org.nz/uploads/1/1/5/2/115245341/interpretations-of-the-holocaust.pdf

And a full list of all my sources https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

n1DeU6NckLM.title: BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E3 Stalemate on the Don
n1DeU6NckLM.description:
The Soviet Union was in deep trouble during the Battle of Stalingrad Campaign. Their economy was on the brink of collapse, with food rations at starvation levels. On the 28th of July 1942, Stalin implements his infamous Order 227, which is welcomed by the troops fighting at the Great Bend of the Don River. Paulus's 6th Army manages to consolidate its positions, but can it prevent Group Zhuravlev from breaking out of its pocket? Let's find out.

(This was formerly S1/E3)

⭐ The next video in this series: https://youtu.be/f3eOKrXmoPU ⭐

WW2 and related videos will still be coming out EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time) so be sure to come back.

The script for this video was 6,057 words.

63yv9w-6_3U.title: TIK vs Wehraboo Amazon Book Reviewers
63yv9w-6_3U.description:
We have Wehraboos reviewing books on Amazon and mass down-voting anything which disagrees with their Weltanschauung (world view). They genuinely believe that the Wehrmacht was "clean" and was the greatest fighting force ever in world history. Well, they're wrong.

History Romancers are a big issue, so today I tackle some of them. Romancers are people who have a fantastical or romantic view of certain periods of history. They either worship the Wehrmacht (Wehraboos), excuse the crimes of Socialism (Marxist Socialists or National Socialists), or even deny that certain historical events took place (Denialists). Their ignorance, dismissal or distortion of evidence, logical fallacies and downright hostility to the truth leads them to false conclusions and to the political extreme. Let's give them a history lesson. #wehraboos #Romancers

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

NOTE: Due to technical issues related to Bandicam, I had to use Sony Vegas Pro to edit this video, and Vegas has a massive issue with text scrolling in videos as I discovered to my horror... So I was unable to put Patron names in this video. This is a one-off issue, so your names will appear in future videos.

- - - - -

Full list of all my sources https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

Y7pij02s428.title: BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E2 Entry of the Tank Armies
Y7pij02s428.description:
The Battle of Stalingrad was the largest land battle in World War II. It was also the longest - an epic seven month campaign lasting from the 21st of July 1942 to the 2nd of February 1943. The fighting for the city has become infamous for its intensity, yet many have forgotten that the battle started outside of the city in July 1942 as Fall Blau (Case Blue) was reaching its zenith. By the 25th of July 1942, Paulus's 6th Army had broken through the 62nd Army's lines and had reached the Don Bend near Kalach. YAfo5mse-ag.title: BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD E1 - The 6th Army Strikes!
YAfo5mse-ag.description:
The Battle of Stalingrad was the largest land battle in World War II. It was also the longest - an epic seven month campaign lasting from the 21st of July 1942 to the 2nd of February 1943. The fighting for the city has become infamous for its intensity, yet many have forgotten that the battle started outside of the city in July 1942 as Fall Blau (Case Blue) was reaching its zenith. The German 6th Army, commanded by Paulus, crashed into Red Army forces defending at the Great Bend of the Don River. From this moment onwards, both sides were in almost continuous battle until the bitter end. In this series, we will explore the battle from start to finish, going into more detail than any documentary on the subject has ever done before. This is BATTLESTORM!

(This was formerly S1/E1 of this Stalingrad documentary series)

The script for this video was 5,390 words.

0d7Kcf_pPiM.title: Why Franco & Spain stayed out of WW2?
0d7Kcf_pPiM.description:
Today we talk about Franco and Spain during the WW2 era, specifically looking into the reasons why Spain stayed out of WW2, their active neutrality (supporting the Axis side), and talking about the Blue Division. This is in response to my Patron, Dan Reed, who asked this question - "Can you talk about the Spanish Blue division? The Spanish were quite good at straddling the fence between England and Germany."

I'm not a Fascist or anything similar, nor am I promoting said ideologies. This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

Want to ask a question? Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. ksAqr4lLA_Y.title: Public vs Private | The Historic Definitions of Socialism & Capitalism
ksAqr4lLA_Y.description:
Many people do not know the difference between the Public and Private Sectors of Society. This is why oxymoronic terms like "State Capitalism" exist. Well, starting in Ancient Greece and Rome and moving forwards in time, we will show what the Public Sector and Private Sectors of the economy are, how they're defined, and explain what both Capitalism and Socialism are and why they are that as well. These are the actual historic definitions and meanings backed up by the sources listed in the pinned comment, at the beginning of the video, and references will be included at the bottom of the screen.

The script for this history video was 12,523 words. And yes, this is a history video. I am neither National Socialist, Fascist, Marxist Socialist or anything else like that. And as you can tell if you watch this video in full, I am absolutely NOT promoting any of these evil ideologies in the slightest.

For a full list of all my sources, check out this link https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

John Hargreaves's original question - "In the creation of the National Socialist state by Hitler, did he not effectively privatize the whole state as his and his board of directors sole control?"

kh7KmtwLUbw.title: The Red Army Air Force in the First Days of Operation Barbarossa
kh7KmtwLUbw.description:
The Red Army Air Force (VVS) was totally unprepared to resist the largest land invasion force in history. When Operation Barbarossa launched on the 22nd of June 1941, many of the Soviet planes were destroyed on their airfields, and those that get up into the air had severe disadvantages against the Luftwaffe. In this video, we'll explore some of the reasons why.

I'm neither defending nor praising either the Soviet Union or the Third Reich in this video; merely explaining the history and the perceptions some have on the events of the past does not mean I support what happened. This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

uJsjxSfB7Ls.title: The Courland Pocket 1944-45 FULL BATTLESTORM History Documentary
uJsjxSfB7Ls.description:
The Courland Pocket formed in late 1944 as Army Group North attempted to retreat from the Leningrad Region and the Baltic States. The Soviet Red Army trapped them in Latvia and lay siege to them until the end of the war. This documentary video uses maps and unit animations to detail the events on the operational level - because that's what BATTLESTORM is all about. Who's to blame for the way this battle turns out? Let's find out!

This is all the Courland videos placed into one complete video. Good luck to all of you who marathon this, and be sure to boast about that in the comment section below!

The script for this video was approximately 47,500 words!

Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

Full list of all my sources https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

00:38:33 Episode 2 "The Baltic Tragedy"
01:02:22 Episode 3 "Operation Doppelkopf"
01:38:16 Episode 4 "Tartu and Operation Cäsar"
02:13:16 Episode 5 "Reconquest of Estonia"
02:50:10 Episode 6 "Cutting off Army Group North"
03:25:38 Episode 7 "The 1st Battle of the Courland Pocket"

rS_59PHhO4M.title: The Debate over German POWs in Soviet Hands WW2
rS_59PHhO4M.description:
History lies in the heart of the debate. And the debate about the Soviet treatment of German POWs continues long after World War II ended. The numbers are up for debate. The percentages are up for debate. But the fact remains that German prisoners didn't have it as bad as Soviet prisoners in WW2, as I showed in my other video https://youtu.be/OeRR100incE

Also, yes, one of the quotes was covered by one of the book covers. Sorry about that.

6tdZis2ZdZE.title: Debate on Warsaw Uprising and Polish Resistance WW2 | TIK History Q&A 23
6tdZis2ZdZE.description:
Two Questions today - 1. TinyGayPirate 04:22 asked: Could you talk a little bit about polish resistance of Armia Krajowa (Home Army) in occupied Poland and did polish resistance have any effect on german logistics at eastern front? And 2. Steve Switzer 40:43 (best to watch the full thing, but especially from 31:30) asked: Do you think Stalin deliberately held back from helping the Home army in Warsaw? The second question is a huge question which I'm not possibly going to be able to cover fully in one video, but I thought I'd give some thoughts on it today. I am sympathetic to the Polish cause, and think Stalin was evil, but that doesn't mean that the Home Army and the Government-in-Exile didn't drop the ball on this one.

Want to ask a question? Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. For $5 or more you can ask questions which I will answer in future Q&A videos. Thank you to my current Patrons! Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

Specific sources used -
Glantz, D. & House, J. “When Titan’s Clashed.” University Press of Kansas, 2015.
Richie, A. “Warsaw 1944: Hitler, Himmler and the Crushing of a City.” Harper Collins Publishers, Kindle 2013.
Walker, J. “Poland Alone: Britain, SOE and the Collapse of the Polish Resistance, 1944.” Spellmount, Kindle.
Williamson, D. “The Polish Underground 1939-1947.” Pen & Sword Books, Kindle 2012.
“The Warsaw Uprising of 1944: The History of the Polish Resistance’s Failed Attempt to Liberate Poland’s Capital from Nazi Germany.” Charles River Editors, Kindle.

OeRR100incE.title: The Fate of Soviet Prisoners of War #WW2 #History
OeRR100incE.description:
Somewhere near 3.3 million Soviet Prisoners of Wars were captured by the Germans in 1941. And around 5.7 million total Soviet POWs were captured in the war against the Third Reich. Many commissars were also captured, which wasn't good, since the Wehrmacht had issued the infamous 'Commissar Order' in order to deal with them. So what was their fate? How did the Germans treat them? This video will tell you.

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

localized.title: The Fate of Soviet Prisoners of War #WW2 #History
localized.description:
Somewhere near 3.3 million Soviet Prisoners of Wars were captured by the Germans in 1941. And around 5.7 million total Soviet POWs were captured in the war against the Third Reich. Many commissars were also captured, which wasn't good, since the Wehrmacht had issued the infamous 'Commissar Order' in order to deal with them. So what was their fate? How did the Germans treat them? This video will tell you.

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

WVtT-NIq1Zg.title: Did Stalin seek a Separate Peace with Hitler in WW2? | TIK Q&A 21
WVtT-NIq1Zg.description:
It appears that Stalin may have sought a separate peace with Hitler in WW2. Thank you to David E Dyrud for your question! Sadly, I've only really found one source which directly addresses this question, so if you know of any others that talk about this, please let me know so I can do a follow-up. Some of my books hint at peace-negotiations happening in 1944, but they are vague. To clarify a point raised in the video, I don't have evidence of negotiations before Stalingrad, but (as a bit of conjecture) I suspect that if there were negotiations in 1942-43, and possibly in 1944, then there's no reason to assume there wasn't any in 1941 or early 1942. Evidence may exist out there... so I'm certainly not ruling it out until it's confirmed one way or another.

The main source used in this video - Vojtech Mastny’s "Stalin and the Prospects of a Separate Peace in World War II." Link: https://www.jstor.org/stable/1861311

Full list of all my sources https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

mAtBvmjNLok.title: Capitulation of the Courland Pocket 1944 | WW2 BATTLESTORM History Documentary Part 11
mAtBvmjNLok.description:
With World War 2 drawing to a close, Axis forces trapped in the Courland Pocket had only one option: surrender. But that question remains - why didn't they evacuate Courland? Was it really "Madman Hitler's" fault, or is there more to it than that? Let's find out...

This video is the last in the series. I will be creating an all-in-one video of this series in a few weeks where I correct some of the minor errors, but otherwise that is it. The next series will be Stalingrad...

xtBJbgGfuhA.title: 4th and 5th Battles of the Courland Pocket 1944 | WW2 BATTLESTORM History Documentary Part 10
xtBJbgGfuhA.description:
Grand Admiral Karl Dönitz is in the firing line this time as we take a look at the 4th and 5th Battles of the Courland Pocket. The evacuation of the Courland Pocket continues, but at a lesser priority during this period due to the evacuation of East Prussia, which is stretching the Kriegsmarine to breaking point. Meanwhile the Soviets strike twice at the Courland Pocket, suffering heavily in the process.

3Ja3z4zt6BQ.title: The Third Battle of the Courland Pocket 1944 | WW2 BATTLESTORM History Documentary Part 9
3Ja3z4zt6BQ.description:
The Third Battle of Courland - also known as the Christmas Battles - took place during late December of 1944. It not only saw the Red Army and German Wehrmacht fighting each other, but Latvians on both sides too. Meanwhile the evacuation of Army Group North continued behind the scenes - something many of the authors have downplayed or ignored.

PQGMjDQ-TJ8.description:
The traditional explanation as to why Hitler had to start WW2 misses out one crucial element of Hitler's reasoning. In this video, not only are we going to spell out exactly what Hitler's reasoning is, but show why certain events - like the Autarky policy, the oil crisis and the Holocaust - were the consequence of that reasoning.

oyOJBaPG8SY.description:
The Red Army tries to break through the German lines in the Second Battle of the Courland Pocket, and is met with stubborn resistence by Army Group North. However, the fighting on Saaremaa comes to an end, and the evacuation of Courland is under way. There's still hope that Army Group North can be evacuated to the homeland.

Mxm30OTk1fQ.title: Cutting off Army Group North in the Courland Pocket 1944 WW2 History Documentary BATTLESTORM Part 6
Mxm30OTk1fQ.description:
Army Group North was withdrawing towards Courland and East Prussia in 1944, when the Soviet 1st Batlic Front and 3rd Belorussian Fronts launched their Memel Offensive. Erhard Raus' Third Panzer Army was crushed, and the Red Army reached the Baltic Sea on both sides of Memel. This trapped Army Group North in Latvia. But who's fault was this? The German souces paint the picture that the 'madman' was to blame, while others tell a different story. Let's find out.

NxwidjWJxAc.title: Hitler's VAMPIRE ECONOMY | TIK Q&A 17
NxwidjWJxAc.description:
Marxist-Socialist Günter Reimann was hiding in Germany in the 1930s. He decided to write and publish a book about the Third Reich's economy in 1939. You can get this book (a primary source document) online as a free PDF, or purchase it on Amazon etc. In this video I discuss the document and see where it goes right and wrong, and explain the nature of Hitler's 'Vampire Economy'.

SOURCES AND NOTES will be in the PINNED COMMENT. Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

jO308MBKs-U.title: Reconquest of Estonia: The Courland Pocket 1944 WW2 History Documentary BATTLESTORM Part 5
jO308MBKs-U.description:
The Tallinn Offensive is underway this time as the Red Army reconquers Estonia. Schörner orders Army Group North to fall back towards Courland, and Raus's Third Panzer Army has all it's panzers taken away. The Estonians also declare independence, but are ultimately crushed by the Soviets. So yes, there's a lot going on this time, and Army Group North is getting closer to being trapped in the Courland Pocket.

Sources and notes will be in the pinned comment. Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

Want to ask a question for me to answer? Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. (detailing the German and Soviet preparations for the next offensives and retreats)

In this video, I want to try and explore this, and discuss the way that I find to keep myself neutral when approaching any historical topic or source. SkUkiZBWOlc.title: Blessed be the Wehraboo
SkUkiZBWOlc.description:
Those who believe in the Manstein, shall receive the gifts of the Manstein.

(As requested. And for those not in the know, Wehraboos are those people who think the German Wehrmacht of WW2 was the greatest  military machine the world has ever seen. But this is only because the Germans generals, led by Halder, were allowed to write a distorted version of history. Well, as all historians should know, thou shall not take ANY primary sources at face value.)

lYY4ukCPsME.title: The Courland Pocket 1944 WW2 History Documentary BATTLESTORM Part 4: Tartu and Operation Cäsar
lYY4ukCPsME.description:
After the failure of Operation Doppelkopf, Third Panzer Army strikes again. This time it's Operation Cäsar - often downplayed as a minor operation. The reality was that it was planned to be a decisive attack, and failed. In this episode we'll look at this operation, and see the action going on elsewhere in the Baltic States. For the Red Army, the Tartu Offensive is on, as is the Riga Offensive Operation, both of which are threatening to encircle huge portions of Army Group North. We'll look at all this, and we'll ask the important question : was Army Group North trying to retreat, or were they ordered to stand fast? Because if they were trying to fall back and failed, this would imply that Hitler was not to blame and that his generals were. Let's find out.

Sources and notes will be in the pinned comment. Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. Thank you to my Patrons! You're AWESOME! https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory or https://www.subscribestar.com/tikhistory

Timestamps -
00:00 Introduction
01:02 Part 1: Chaos at Tartu
(Offensive towards Tartu, amphibious assault over Lake Peipus, and the Battle of Tartu)
07:23 The Finnish government open negotiations with the Soviet Union
08:43 Aftermath of the Soviet Summer Offensives, and the planning of the next
11:36 Part 2: Why Not Retreat?
(Asking the question: why did Army Group North not retreat? And who's fault is that? 12:29 The Finnish exit the war)
20:33 Part 3: Then Fall Cäsar!
(starts with the planning for Operation Cäsar)
21:55 The Baltic Offensive
23:12 Riga Offensive Operation
25:32 Final dicussion over "Map Exercise Aster" and whether Army Group North was trying to retreat.
28:48 Operation Cäsar
33:16 Outro, Patreons and Question?

Here’s some other videos you may be interested in -

The MAIN Reason Why Germany Lost WW2 - OIL https://youtu.be/kVo5I0xNRhg

FALL BLAU 1942 - Examining the Disaster of German’s second summer offensive https://youtu.be/hzr6dD8fvVY

History isn’t as boring as some people think, and my goal is to get people talking about it. I also want to dispel the myths and distortions that ruin our perception of the past by asking a simple question - “But is this really the case?”. I have a 2:1 Degree in History and a passion for early 20th Century conflicts (mainly WW2). I’m therefore approaching this like I would an academic essay. Lots of sources, quotes, references and so on. Only the truth will do.

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

2y0Gwo8EbuE.title: The Courland Pocket 1944-45 WW2 BATTLESTORM History Documentary Part 3 | Operation Doppelkopf
2y0Gwo8EbuE.description:
In the aftermath of Operation Bagration, the Red Army reaches the Gulf of Riga, trapping Army Group North in a giant pocket. Erhard Raus leads Third Panzer Army in an attempt to break through to Schörner's men. This attempt is Operation Doppelkopf 1944 (Operation Doublehead) without which Army Group North could not have fallen back into the Courland Pocket.

Sources and notes will be in the pinned comment. Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. Thank you to my Patrons! You're AWESOME! https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory or https://www.subscribestar.com/tikhistory

Timestamps
00:00 Intro
00:52 Part 1 Soviet Summer Storm 1944 (Operation Bagration)
02:23 German Reaction (Guderian and Schörner)
03:44 Army Group North resists attacks from the 3rd Baltic and Leningrad Fronts
05:40 1st Baltic Front fights at Jelgava
06:22 Finland has second thoughts
07:20 Eremenko's 2nd Baltic Front
08:28 1st Baltic Front strikes to the Gulf of Riga
10:10 Aftermath of reaching the Baltic - German and Finnish reactions
12:06 Bloody Ferdinand
13:19 The Red Army reaches German soil
13:48 Part 2 Operation Doppelkopf 1944

localized.title: The Courland Pocket 1944-45 WW2 BATTLESTORM History Documentary Part 3 | Operation Doppelkopf
localized.description:
In the aftermath of Operation Bagration, the Red Army reaches the Gulf of Riga, trapping Army Group North in a giant pocket. Erhard Raus leads Third Panzer Army in an attempt to break through to Schörner's men. This attempt is Operation Doppelkopf 1944 (Operation Doublehead) without which Army Group North could not have fallen back into the Courland Pocket.

Sources and notes will be in the pinned comment. Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

KBAoW0PWNUw.title: German Logistics (or lack of) in WW2 Eastern Front | TIK Q&A 11
KBAoW0PWNUw.description:
German logistics of WW2 were terrible. In fact, the war on the Axis-Soviet Front may have been determined by the poor logistics of the Wehrmacht. The lack of oil and rubber plays it part, but the Germans messed up the use off their trains and railroads. The result was that they could only so far into the Soviet Union before they had to stop. Let's discuss this.

Timestamps -
00:15 Todd R Smith - were chainsaws used in Russia?  Why were "corduroy roads" roads surfaced with cut logs, not used?
30:13 Steve Switzer - Despite bad logistics, why was the wehrmacht still formidable until 1943?
37:36 Robert Henry Illston - how detrimental to the Axis/German supply/logistic chain were acts of sabotage?

Main source for the video (no real need for a pinned comment this time) - Creveld, M. "Supplying War: Logistics from Wallenstein to Patton." Cambridge University Press, Second Edition 2004.

Source about Corduroy Roads -
https://history.army.mil/books/wwii/milimprov/ch05.htm

All my other sources on WW2/related -
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

PWY3ByskitQ.title: The Courland Pocket WW2 History Documentary BATTLESTORM Part 2 The Baltic Tragedy
PWY3ByskitQ.description:
The Baltic States were occupied by the Soviet Union in 1940, then occupied by National Socialist Germany in 1941, then reoccupied by the Soviet Union in 1944/45. From 1940 to 1990, they remained subjugated illegally by foreign powers. Caught in a vice between two evil socialist regimes, the Baltic peoples suffered a tragedy almost too shocking to describe. This is their story.

Sources and notes will be in the pinned comment. Videos in this series will be out bi-weekly, but there will be a video on this channel EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

S6hwBiRWMkA.description:
Time to discuss the changing WW2 Historiography of WW2. Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

Hey everyone! Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. Thank you to my Patrons! You're AWESOME! https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory or https://www.subscribestar.com/tikhistory

Video Questions and Timestamps -

00:16 Richard Stokes - Has anyone written an updated book on the changing historiography of WW2?

19:17 Alex Bujnicki - What strategy would you have pursued as the Axis in order to win the war?

26:55 Ken Cone - Was the British decision to stay in the war was the actual turning point of WWII?

29:39 Luke Larkin - Were German soldiers in 1943/44 battle hardened veterans that dominate the battlefield and old men and kids scared beyond belief?

34:09 Yogikhan - Was WW1 and the high loss of officers the cause of the poor performance and poor leadership of the early British Army in North Africa?

40:40 Ben Drasin - Do you play any World War II strategy games (board or video)? Any you particularly think do a good job of capturing the strategic decision-making of the real thing?

43:52 Besotten Jenny - TIK, if you were a young man in the UK in 1939 and had to sign up for frontline service until the end of the war, what would you sign up for, and why?

45:45 Richard Stokes - Who sacked more generals in WW2? Hitler or Churchill?

_yorr3va_Ug.title: The Courland Pocket 1944-45 WW2 Documentary BATTLESTORM Part 1 Scraping the Barrel
_yorr3va_Ug.description:
The Courland Pocket was formed in late 1944 as Army Group North retreated from East in the face of superior Red Army forces. In this BATTLESTORM series, we will see the fighting unfold step by step and ask some hard questions - was the pocket avoidable? Who's fault was it? And why didn't the Soviets crush the Germans in the pocket? These answers and more will be answered in this in-depth history documentary series. In this episode, we take a look at the German Army and the Red Army, and compare their manpower, equipment, organization, and strategic capabilities. Clearly, both sides were scraping the barrel by mid-1944. Sources and notes will be in the pinned comment.

This series will be bi-weekly, with videos every-other Monday at 5pm GMT. But I will be doing videos on the Mondays in between, so be sure to check back each week.

Please consider supporting me on either Patreon or SubscribeStar and help make more videos like this possible. Thank you to my Patrons! You're AWESOME! Support me here: https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory or here: https://www.subscribestar.com/tikhistory

00:00 Intro
02:19 Act 1 Pre-Battle Chapter 1: Scraping the Barrel
Discussing the Strategic Situation up until 1944
04:11 Why did Germany keep fighting?
05:28 German Optimism (Dönitz's new submarines and Guderian)
07:09 V-1 and V-2 rockets
08:42 "Fortress Towns" concept
10:52 German Officer Shortage and Impact
15:13 Wasn't the German Army getting smaller?
(discussing the organizational changes and division sizes of German units)
17:46 State of the Red Army 1944
(discussing the organizational changes and division sizes of Soviet units)
19:03 Red Army vs German Army unit sizes compared
20:48 The Soviets were Scraping the Barrel
22:35 Axis vs Soviet Manpower
25:13 Soviet manpower, organizational and material advantages (including Lend Lease)
27:21 Soviet Tank units and tanks compared to German Panzer units and panzers
30:13 German fuel crisis and the grounded Luftwaffe
31:54 German vs Soviet tanks at the tactical level, plus production comparisons
35:51 Combined Arms Warfare
37:11 Outro

22:35 Axis vs Soviet Manpower
25:13 Soviet manpower, organizational and material advantages (including Lend Lease)

nnyJ-qlzZGk.title: The Rations and Fate of the Civilians at the Siege of Leningrad
nnyJ-qlzZGk.description:
The city of Leningrad was under siege for 872 days. As a result, the rations were cut to starvation-levels. Even so, the food almost ran out! Confitions were terrible for the civilians, who suffered horribly. Technically, the siege of Leningrad was a Soviet "victory". However, for the civilians of city of Leningrad, victory came at a huge price, as we will discuss in this video.

Sources and notes will be in the pinned comment. Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).
