6GgokduUvQ8.title: AFTER ARNHEM 1944 | Q&A 9
6GgokduUvQ8.description:
Sources and notes will be in the pinned comment. Videos EVERY Monday at 5pm GMT (depending on season, check for British Summer Time).

Monty asked - “What happened AFTER Market Garden?" And while he was asking exclusively about the military side, I thought I'd expand the question to include what happened in Arnhem and the Netherlands after the Battle of Arnhem. So here's the answer. We'll be covering Operation Pegasus, Operation Pegasus II, the Dutch famine of 1944–45, and asking why the Allies didn't advance further into the Netherlands after Market Garden.

Please consider supporting me on Patreon and help make more videos like this possible. Thank you to my Patreons! You're AWESOME! https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

00:09 Mario Babić - How effective was German ground anti-air weaponry against Allied airforce?

10:28 trinimac and Nick Hambly - Who was the first to bomb civilians in WW2? Which 'group' or individuals was tasked with overseeing this 'arm' of the RAF. in particular with target assignment?

Ji7MZYB4dho.title: Operation Crusader 1941 FULL WW2 Documentary BATTLESTORM
Ji7MZYB4dho.description:
Operation Crusader aimed to relieve the Tobruk Siege, but turned into the most complicated and confusing battles in World War 2, if not in world history! Erwin Rommel's Afrika Korps faced the British Eighth Army as the North African Campaign hung in the balance. This documentary video uses maps and unit animations to detail the events on the operational level - because that's what BATTLESTORM is all about. Watch as the British plan unfolds, how the New Zealanders fight for Sidi Rezegh, and how Rommel makes his 'Dash to the Wire'. Who's to blame for the way this battle turns out? Let's find out!

Good luck to all of you who marathon this, and be sure to boast about that in the comment section below!

The script for this video was approx 84,300 words.

YOUTUBE SUBTITLE ISSUE - I spent 8 hours hours wrestling with technical glitches whilst trying to put subtitles into this video. Every time I “saved” the subtitles, some sentences would be replaced by random other subtitles, and it was almost impossible to edit anything due to extremely heavy jittering and stuttering on the subtitle editing page. It’s definitely because of the length of the video. If you want to see this series with subtitles, please check out the individual Crusader videos, which do have subtitles.

PYLdxM8td8M.title: TIK's 5 New Years Resolutions 2019 (and video plans)
PYLdxM8td8M.description:
Has it really been a year since the last lot of resolutions? Wow, time flies when you've got your head in the history books! Well, let's see what 2019 will bring... Courland and Stalingrad mainly.

FYI Academic Agent responed to yesterday's economics video, so here's the link to his video https://youtu.be/QPqPnWTaMrE

And my original Economics video https://youtu.be/YFDQ1jrvDbs

Here’s some other videos you may be interested in -

The MAIN Reason Why Germany Lost WW2 - OIL https://youtu.be/kVo5I0xNRhg

FALL BLAU 1942 - Examining the Disaster of German’s second summer offensive https://youtu.be/hzr6dD8fvVY

The Myth and Reality of Joseph Stalin’s Order No. 227 “Not a Step Back!” https://youtu.be/JOKAIDpOY80

My video entitled “Why I'm Passionate about HISTORY and What Got Me Into it”
https://youtu.be/KnpCaLH9z7M

History isn’t as boring as some people think, and my goal is to get people talking about it. I also want to dispel the myths and distortions that ruin our perception of the past by asking a simple question - “But is this really the case?”. I have a 2:1 Degree in History and a passion for early 20th Century conflicts (mainly WW2). I’m therefore approaching this like I would an academic essay. Lots of sources, quotes, references and so on. Only the truth will do.

Check out the pinned comment below for more information, notes, links, and sources. Also, please consider supporting me on Patreon and help make more videos like this possible https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

YFDQ1jrvDbs.title: The 1 Basic Economics Principle People Misunderstand
YFDQ1jrvDbs.description:
Economics can be a complicated issue, so I've removed most of the complexity and got down to the core of the issue. It turns out that money isn't what most people assume it is. And yes, after several arguments in the comment sections of my videos where certain people assumed they knew how economies worked, I thought it best to make a video to clarify why they're mistaken. I'm fairly certain they won't listen, since that's their nature, but it's worth explaining it for everyone else so that you don't get mislead by the claims of those people in the future.

Some of you expecting history videos may be wondering why I've covered this topic. Well, I can't cover Lend Lease, or certain other non-war topics which I've promised to cover, unless we get the basics down. This is one of those basic videos which will enable me to move onto other history topics.

Please check out the pinned comment below for more information, notes, links, and sources. Also, please consider supporting me on Patreon and help make more videos like this possible https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

Academic Agent's response video https://youtu.be/QPqPnWTaMrE

Learn Liberty also says the exact same thing in their video "Why Not Print More Money?" https://youtu.be/ZkyBnaYCUhw

Here’s some other videos you may be interested in -

ReasonTV “This LA Musician Built $1,200 Tiny Houses for the Homeless. Then the City Seized Them.” https://youtu.be/n6h7fL22WCE

Academic Agent’s “The Origins of Money” https://youtu.be/fWDn1-dyXDg (watch first) and “Understanding Inflation” https://youtu.be/nnisOz2nGFc 

Academic Agent’s “Why Workers Are Not Exploited in the Free Market” https://youtu.be/iIONcSbrxbQ

“Does Capitalism Exploit Workers? - Learn Liberty” https://youtu.be/4Ttbj6LAu0A

Thomas Sowell explains “Trickle Down Theory” myth made up by Marxists https://youtu.be/nZPDpk8NA-g

Valuetainment’s “How to Start a Business for under $500” https://youtu.be/rKAAzZFLPEs

Milton Friedman’s “The Robin Hood Myth” https://youtu.be/5Wx5PYZIWcQ ||| and "Monetary Policy" (explaining inflation and showing inflation in different countries through charts) https://youtu.be/6LfUyML5QVY ||| and “Understanding Inflation” https://youtu.be/GJ4TTNeSUdQ ||| and “Case Against Equal Pay for Equal Work” https://youtu.be/hsIpQ7YguGE ||| and “The Great Depression Myth” https://youtu.be/dgyQsIGLt_w

ReasonTV “The $15 Minimum Wage Is Turning Hard Workers Into Black Market Lawbreakers” https://youtu.be/0fsVI3EmUnQ

History isn’t as boring as some people think, and my goal is to get people talking about it. I also want to dispel the myths and distortions that ruin our perception of the past by asking a simple question - “But is this really the case?”. I have a 2:1 Degree in History and a passion for early 20th Century conflicts (mainly WW2). I’m therefore approaching this like I would an academic essay. Lots of sources, quotes, references and so on. Only the truth will do.

LlOZdrvnIfk.title: South African Historians TRY to Defend PIENAAR
LlOZdrvnIfk.description:
South African Historians Agar-Hamilton and Turner tried to defend Dan Pienaar's inaction during Operation Crusader 1941. This video is an indepth and detailed look into Agar-Hamilton's book, and full analysis of Pienaar's actions. Is there a valid defence? Not really...

5mRaotz1rKU.title: ACCIDENTAL VICTORY | Operation Crusader Part 15 (the End)
5mRaotz1rKU.description:
The End of Operation Crusader is here, and it really can be described as an "Accidental Victory". The Axis have fallen back, and the British somehow win it. Let's discuss the entire battle and figure out who's to blame for the way things went. Your opinions matter so let me know!

GWUaoleJKIo.title: New Zealand's Final Stand | Operation Crusader WW2 Part 13
GWUaoleJKIo.description:
Rommel strikes against Freyberg's 2nd New Zealand Division again, as the British bring up reinforcements in order to try keep Operation Crusader alive. However, the offensive grinds to a halt, and the battle becomes a stalemate as both Axis and Allied forces are exhausted. Can either side break the stalemate? Let's find out.

Timestamps
00:00 Intro
00:32 Part 1 ‘Freyberg Falls Back’
  02:25 15th Panzer Division strikes 4th New Zealand Brigade
  04:27 Major Burton’s Birthday (plus 4th Armoured Brigade arrives)
  05:31 Nash vs Playfair on the Gott vs Gatehouse issue
  07:25 The British and New Zealanders begin to withdraw
  09:06 Ritchie and Auchinleck
  10:55 British Reinforcements
  12:02 Freyberg makes the decision
  14:15 Situation at the Frontier
  14:50 2nd New Zealand Division Retreats
  15:42 Overall situation
17:08 Part 2 ‘Stalemate’
  Starting with Rommel’s 2nd Dash to the Wire Plan
  19:57 The Germans strike towards Bardia
  20:58 Ritchie reacts
  21:55 Indians attack Point 182 and Bir el Gubi
  23:12 Rommel’s concerns
  24:19 Actions at Sidi Rezegh and El Duda
  24:54 Rommel’s supply situation
  26:22 Tobruk siege is lifted again
  27:33 Actions around Bir el Gubi
  28:52 Exhaustion on both sides
  30:41 WHERE IS GAMBARA!?
  34:31 Neumann-Silkow goes to Derna
35:11 Outro and Patreons

bbKOFjgzxJg.title: The Infantry Battle | Operation Crusader Part 12
bbKOFjgzxJg.description:
Operation Crusader moves into a different phase - the infantry phase. Both of Rommel's Panzer Divisions and Eighth Army's Armoured Brigades no longer have the strength to carry on the fight. Instead, Freyberg's 2nd New Zealand Division and Pienaar's 1st South African Brigade are now in the line of fire. But Brigadier Dan Pienaar is no longer willing to play ball...

Timestamps
00:00 Intro
00:39 Part 1. ‘The Tank Clash’
  01:59 21st Panzer Division is exhausted
  02:50 Ritchie’s first order
  04:26 Pienaar’s ordered to go north
  04:54 2nd New Zealand Division holds on
06:27 Part 2. ‘The First German General’
  07:17 Axis moves
  08:01 British counter moves
  08:59 Pienaar moves north (sort of)
  10:03 13th Corps and co retreat into Tobruk
  10:38 Rommel doesn’t court martial Westphal
  12:15 Supplies reach the New Zealanders (plus German moves)
  13:15 The Ariete moves
  14:06 15th Panzer Division attacks El Duda
  15:09 Pienaar sits still
  15:36 British morale has collapsed
  16:49 Surprise at Point 175
  17:43 Pienaar’s ignores all orders
  18:42 Australians Counterattack at El Duda
  19:38 Reinforcements
20:37 Part 3 ‘The Epic of Pienaar’
  Starting with actions by the RAF and SAAF
  21:16 22nd Armoured Brigade withdraws
  22:31 Pienaar’s Defiance part 1
  23:44 6th New Zealand Brigade gets crushed
  26:40 Pienaar’s Defiance part 2
  28:56 Positions on the Evening of 30th of November 1941
  30:43 General Bastico arrives to speak with Rommel
31:39 Patreons and Outro

nqsrTltW_GI.title: TALES FROM RETAIL
nqsrTltW_GI.description:
Idiot customers, idiot scenarios, idiot CEO's... yep, that's retail for you. Here's my experience working 11 years of retail (in the same company) plus change. And no, these are all genuine experiences that actually happened to me at one point or another. Started as part time staff member, then became a supervisor, then a manager. I've been through the customer service trenches and will do everything I can not to go back into retail, so...

...please consider supporting me on Patreon and make sure I never have to sell my soul again https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

And yes, this is a bit different from my normal videos. Normally I make super-detailed and accurate history videos about WW2. If you're interested in WW2, here's a playlist with them all in - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledhMtb3bsJkJmtECxS_mm_QM

And the original (old) video where the Retail animation was from (2013) https://youtu.be/QB6b23eiYxw

WpDPSHlx5U4.title: The End of Cunningham | Operation Crusader Part 11
WpDPSHlx5U4.description:
Alan Cunningham is about to be sacked by Auchinleck. But who will his replacement be? Operation Crusader is slowly entering a new phase as Rommel's Dash to the Wire also comes to an end. 30 Corps is battered but recovering, the Afrika Korps is now disorganized and weakened, and the 2nd New Zealand Division manages to take Sidi Rezegh. However, Rommel realises that the battle at Sidi Rezegh is the main event, and so begins to move his panzer divisions towards the 2nd New Zealand Division.

Timestamps!
00:00 Intro
00:45 Part 1 ‘Choosing a Successor’
  01:08 The New Zealanders advance on Sidi Rezegh
  04:28 The Afrika Korps struggles at the Frontier
  07:25 Pienaar requests help!
  07:54 Westphal requests help too!
  10:59 Auchinleck chooses Cunningham’s Successor
  11:51 Neil Ritchie
13:34 Part 2 ‘Conflicting Orders’
  Starting with 4th Armoured Brigade reaching Pienaar’s unit
  14:31 Rommel’s plans
  15:46 15th Panzer Division moves north
  16:48 Westphal orders Ravenstein to help!
  17:53 The Tobruk Garrison reaches El Duda
  19:07 Maoris and New Zealanders battle von Ravenstein
  19:50 Pienaar let’s the Ariete Division pass
  20:13 The New Zealanders lift the Siege of Tobruk
21:10 Part 3 ‘Cunningham Replaced’
  Starting with Cunningham being replaced
  23:15 Auchinleck holds Ritchie’s hand
  24:03 Rommel’s WRATH
  25:11 Rommel realises that Tobruk is the priority
  26:29 Crüwell vs Rommel
  29:23 The Fall of 5th New Zealand Brigade
  31:02 Charge of the 23rd New Zealand Infantry Battalion
  31:44 22nd New Zealand Battalion holds Menastir
  33:01 Rommel and his wife
  34:16 Crüwell moves north
  34:46 Freyberg’s grave situation
  36:37 Number of Tanks left
37:59 Outro and Patreons!

8pS54t-a3Z4.title: MALTA's Impact on the North African Campaign WW2... And More! TIK Q&A 5
8pS54t-a3Z4.description:
The Siege of Malta was a major event in WW2, and the fate of the island directly impacted the amount of supplies Rommel received in North Africa. But is this really the case? Let's look at the role the island played, and the events going on around it - like what was happening in Iran, Iraq, and the rest of the Middle East.

00:29 swe420den - Is Malta's value as a base overstated and the axis decided it wasn't a priority?

14:02 Torin Palmer - How big of a role did the Middle East campaign against Vichy France, Iraq, and Iran play during the war?

17:04 Alex Bujnicki and Kevin Kaiser - How would taking Cairo have impacted the outcome of the war? Would the Axis have been able to exploit the Oil fields in Egypt and Iraq, or would the Allies have been able to at least defend the Iraqi ones? Where did the fuel for the British desert gear come from?

29:12 Alex Bujnicki - How was Turkey so easily able to stay out of the war with a massive superpower on every border?

The rest of my videos in the Q&A series https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledjSi5kHrxcRnD1f7PCZisAL

My North African Campaign Series https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledivgjjFkhXw9y5RRvr7kNoe

PYVPYdufcVM.title: Sunday of the Dead 1941 | Operation Crusader WW2 Part 9
PYVPYdufcVM.description:
This video is a historical documentary about the WW2 battle of Operation Crusader of 1941, specifically the events of 23rd November 1941 - which is Totensonntag. The word "Totensonntag" (German for: "Dead Sunday") is the name given to the day which is covered in this episode. It is not about "dead" people or anything else, it is about the North African Campaign of WW2. While the name may have the word "dead" in it, and the thumbnail has a skull in it, all this can be safely ignored as no skulls or dead things are shown in the video. It is also not clickbait, since this is 100% relevant to the video (the day impacted the fighting morale of the German troops, and the fighting on this day led to several battle units getting destroyed - but again, the units fade off the map in the video, nothing bad is shown). Thank you.

(And, if I forget to change the description before publishing, the above is addressed to the YouTube employee who will be reviewing this video)

  Starts by explaining what Totensonntag is

  26:39 Crüwell prepares his forces
  27:40 New Zealanders at Point 175
  28:52 The Panzers Begin their Advance
29:31 Part 3 ‘Crisis Point’
  The Panzers strike 5th South African Brigade
  32:42 The flight of the British armour
  33:24 The Aftermath
  34:42 Reactions and 13th Corps
  35:22 The British Command Crisis Continues
  36:13 Outro and Patreons!

9mAzZEZ3BZs.title: Was Germany's Defeat Inevitable in WW2? Turning Point? And more... TIK Patreon Q&A 4
9mAzZEZ3BZs.description:
Time for another Q&A! And we're off to the Eastern Front of WW2 again to see when the turning point of the war was? Was Germany's defeat in WWII inevitable? And we'll be talking about the Battle of Rzhev 1941, and Soviet Partisans.

Please consider supporting me on Patreon and help make more videos like this possible, thank you!
https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

Timestamps
00:57 Semih Sander - Germany's defeat Inevitable August 1941?
14:05 Joseph Keenan - How could Germany win on the Eastern Front?
21:28 Claus Adler - Was Rzhev to prevent the Germans sending forces south?
34:10 Wojciech Prokop - Soviet Partisans bandits or successful?

Books used -
Glantz, D. "Zhukov's Greatest Defeat: The Red Army's Epic Disaster in Operation Mars, 1942." University Press of Kansas, 1999.
Guderian, H. “Panzer Leader.” Penguin Books, 2000.
Hill, A. “The War Behind the Eastern Front: The Soviet Partisan Movement in North-West Russia 1941-44.” Frank Cass, 2006.
Liedtke, G. “Enduring the Whirlwind: The German Army and the Russo-German War 1941-1943.” Helion & Company LTD, 2016.
Reimann, G. “The Vampire Economy: Doing Business under Fascism.” Kindle, Mises Institute, 2007. Originally written in 1939.
Tooze, A. “Wages of Destruction: The Making & Breaking of The Nazi Economy.” Penguin Books, 2007.

For a full list of all my books, check here - https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/114GiK85MPs0v4GKm0izPj3DL2CrlJUdAantx5GQUKn8/edit?usp=sharing

8yW4XYkejL0.title: THE PANZERS STRIKE | BATTLESTORM Operation Crusader Part 8
8yW4XYkejL0.description:
Rommel unleashes the Panzer Divisions against 7th Armoured Division at Sidi Rezegh. Yes, the armoured battle that Auchinleck and Cunningham had wanted has finally arrived, but with Gott, Norrie, Davy, and Jock Campbell be able to win it? Or with the Germans, with Crüwell and von Ravenstein, crush them? Operation Crusader is about to heat up, and the British are in trouble.

00:00 Introduction
01:06 Part 1 “The Hunt”
  03:00 Cunningham’s Reaction

  17:21 Aftermath of the first wave

  24:15 13th Corps Attacks!
  25:15 Rommel and Crüwell’s Plans
  28:10 Cunningham’s Reaction
  31:59 13th Corps keeps on advancing!

  38:43 The Legendary Actions of Jock Campbell

localized.title: THE PANZERS STRIKE | BATTLESTORM Operation Crusader Part 8
localized.description:
Rommel unleashes the Panzer Divisions against 7th Armoured Division at Sidi Rezegh. Yes, the armoured battle that Auchinleck and Cunningham had wanted has finally arrived, but with Gott, Norrie, Davy, and Jock Campbell be able to win it? Or with the Germans, with Crüwell and von Ravenstein, crush them? Operation Crusader is about to heat up, and the British are in trouble.

Dq4GMAWGjYY.title: Dancing Panzer, Hidden Rommel | BATTLESTORM Operation Crusader Part 7
Dq4GMAWGjYY.description:
Ludwig Crüwell reacts to the British Crusader offensive by sending the 15th and 21st Panzer Divisions towards Gabr Saleh. 4th Armoured Brigade makes a stand (actually two) against each of them, as both German and British commands completely misinterpret the situation. After listening to Gott and Norrie, Cunningham gives the codeword "Pop", signalling the start of the Tobruk sortie, and Rommel continues to resist the idea that the British are actually attacking... until the BBC confirms his worst fears. Yes, perhaps the worst day in the history of the North African Campaign of World War II, with neither side making any good decisions. And it's only going to get worse from here!

This is BATTLESTORM Operation Crusader Part 7. You can find the other episodes in this series here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledjvQKDHORAPuJdug2sY4lrL

Timestamps
00:00 Intro
00:50 Part 1 “Panzer Clash”
03:29 Results of 4th Armoured Brigade vs Kampfgruppe Stephan
06:45 Evening decisions with no information
11:05 Crüwell misinterprets the situation
12:45 Part 2 “Dancing Panzer, Hidden Rommel”
12:58 The Afrika Division attack Sidi Rezegh
14:20 Crüwell’s Capuzzo Dance
15:04 Woes of 21st Panzer Division
16:39 Crüwell reinterprets the situation and Rejects Rommel
18:22 Cunningham Misreads the Situation
19:56 Cunningham now realizes the problem
23:56 Who’s fault was this?
24:36 The Battle of Gabr Saleh
27:05 Results of the battle and more misinterpretations
29:07 “Pop”
31:00 Never trust the BBC News
31:52 The Influence of the Oasis Force
32:58 Rommel on the Hunt
34:56 Outro

History isn’t as boring as some people think, and my goal is to get people talking about it. I also want to dispel the myths and distortions that ruin our perception of the past by asking a simple question - “But is this really the case?”. I have a 2:1 Degree in History and a passion for early 20th Century conflicts (mainly WW2). I’m therefore approaching this like I would an academic essay. Lots of sources, quotes, references and so on. Only the truth will do.

gsJF78-8Egk.title: OPERATION CRUSADER BEGINS (Crusader Part 6)
gsJF78-8Egk.description:
Operation Crusader began on the 18th of November 1941. After a good start, the British plan completely unravelled - before they'd even seen the enemy! Erwin Rommel (the Desert Fox) wasn't convinced of the seriousness of the British attack, and so dismissed it as a deception attempt. This left the Italian Ariete Division alone to stop the Eighth Army at the First Battle of Bir el Gubi.

This is BATTLESTORM Operation Crusader Part 6. You can find the other episodes in this series here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledjvQKDHORAPuJdug2sY4lrL

7dQgwXEMdi8.title: Delayed video this week
7dQgwXEMdi8.description:
My video this week will be delayed and will be up on Tuesday instead of Monday. My PSU (a Corsair CX750M) is smelling or burning plastic, so there's no way I'm risking a fire by continuing to use it. Frustratingly, the video is mostly done - maybe an hour worth of work left on it, then render (couple hours) and upload and prepare (couple hours) - so it would have been nice for the PSU to have waited until after I'd got the video ready, but no.

And I'm also not counting this as a departure from my New Years Resolution to upload a video every Monday this year, simply because the video would have been out in time if it wasn't for a hardware failure.

mzdjBwxippE.title: Trying to KILL Rommel - Operation Flipper 1941 (Plus Squatter, and Sommernachtstraum) Crusader 5
mzdjBwxippE.description:
Rommel's life hangs in the balance as Keyes' 11th Commando (Scottish) comes crashing into his villa at Beda Littoria (Sidi Rafa) in Operation Flipper. And Stirling's L Detachment of the SAS Regiment (Brigade at this point) launch their first mission ever - Operation Squatter. And Rommel also launches a raid into Egypt to figure out what the British are up to - Operation Sommernachtstraum (Summer's Nights Dream). So yes, it's all kicking off this episode!

This is episode 5 in my Operation Crusader series. You can find the other episodes here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledjvQKDHORAPuJdug2sY4lrL

bYO0seYRBYM.title: Halder's Cunning Plan to STOP Erwin Rommel | Operation Crusader 1941 Part 4
bYO0seYRBYM.description:
Franz Halder hates Rommel. So much so, that he's willing to undermine German grand strategy just to spite him. Rommel is massively impacted by this... although, not in the way Halder hoped. We'll also look at the state of Axis forces as a result of Halder's plot, and see what positions the German and Italian divisions were in prior to Operation Crusader in 1941.

iRmyqd6bi0I.title: The Crusader Plan | BATTLESTORM Operation Crusader WW2 Part 3
iRmyqd6bi0I.description:
The plan for Operation Crusader was full of flaws. So much so, that the British commanders argued over it before the battle had even begun. Compromises had to be made in order to keep Generals Norrie, Godwin-Austen, and Freyberg happy, but they made things difficult for Eighth Army's commander. Cunningham had doubts about his own plan, and the whole operation relied on what Rommel did... clearly not a flawless plan.

Check out the pinned comment below for more information, notes, links, and sources. Also, please consider supporting me on Patreon and help make more videos like this possible https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

KxQ7lJRWtfQ.title: The State of the British Eighth Army | BATTLESTORM Operation Crusader Part 2
KxQ7lJRWtfQ.description:
Who were the British commanders? Were they prepared for the upcoming battle? What tanks did they have? This week, it's all about British forces prior to Operation Crusader, and we discover that the new British Eighth Army was going into battle with some serious flaws. Perhaps it was unfit for duty? Perhaps Cunningham was the wrong guy for the job? Maybe Auchinleck was under too much pressure? Maybe their new Crusader tanks and their M3 Light Tanks weren't up for the job? Either way, Eighth Army was about to go up against Rommel and the Afrika Korps at a disadvantage.

Timestamps
00:00 Intro British Commanders
00:39 Part 1 The Auk’s Commanders
   01:23 General Alan Cunningham
   05:42 General Godwin-Austen (13th Corps)

   08:01 Brigadier Galloway (Eighth Army HQ)

09:04 Part 2 British Units and Doctrine

   28:44 Reid’s Oasis Force, plus other smaller, reserve and reinforcements

_pBfn6UVktY.title: Churchill Does it AGAIN | The REAL Operation Crusader 1941-42 BATTLESTORM Part 1
_pBfn6UVktY.description:
This was the first victory over Erwin Rommel in the North African Campaign of World War 2, and yet has largely been forgotten. Operation Crusader is a swirling and confusing mess of a battle unlike any other in history, and really should have been a British defeat. In this video (the first in a series on this battle), we'll look at the strategic context, summarise Rommel's first battles, see the sacking of Wavell, find out who Auchinleck was, and what Churchill was up to.

Video Timestamps!
00:00 Beginning
  00:54 Intro, Schedule and Info
01:27 Part 1 Strategy
  03:01 British Joke
  03:16 Operation Barbarossa’s Impact on the North African Campaign
  05:08 Securing the Middle East in 1941
  05:45 Why the North African Campaign is Important
  06:25 Should the Germans have focused on North Africa?
07:55 Part 2 Fall of Wavell - Rise of The Auk
  08:07 Why most historians see the relief of Wavell as unfair
  11:16 Sir Claude Auchinleck | Biography
  13:06 The Churchill Factor
  18:28 Outro

dprGvO5GG9c.title: The State of Soviet Artillery on the Eve of Operation Barbarossa WW2 [FIXED]
dprGvO5GG9c.description:
What was the state of Soviet Artillery, Mortars and Anti-Tank guns on the Axis-Soviet Front on the eve of the Great Patriotic War? Well, it was a state...

Link to previous (incorrect) edition of this video https://youtu.be/Jb3Nawprv08

My video explaining why I took it down https://youtu.be/M-JOA8BZ6s4

Some have suggested that the Soviet Union was preparing to attack in the July of 1941. Well, considering that Soviet artillery, anti-tank and mortar units were basically incapable of defense, let alone attack, it really doesn't make any sense that the Soviets would attack. And this is before we hear that the Soviets were actually outnumbered on day 1 of the war, and that their air and tank forces were in very much the same state. Here's some follow-up videos which address this in further detail -

Soviet "War-Winning" Tanks in 1941? The Role of Tanks on the Eastern Front WW2 https://youtu.be/DkDiYuWlgV8

Why You NEED to Think Critically | Suvorov and Keitel's "Preemptive Strike" 1941 Idea https://youtu.be/TyANHGWbUHA

How BIG were Soviet Armies and Divisions in 1942? And what impact did this have? https://youtu.be/wDslsMgnphI

Stalin’s Purge of the Red Army and Its Effects on the WW2 Eastern Front https://youtu.be/JnWNnI6YlQQ

usBKGE4w5NI.title: Lend Lease to the Soviet Union, the Soviet and German Economies, and more... TIK Q&A 3
usBKGE4w5NI.description:
American Lend Lease has often been seen as vital to the Soviet Union for winning WW2. But is this really the case? This is related to the fragility of the Soviet War economy, especially in coal mining, which is explored in the video as well. In addition, numerous questions were asked by my Patreons related to the Eastern Front of World War II, including German oil problems, the Stalingrad and Caucasus campaigns, Kursk, and other battles elsewhere like the Battle of Sicily. Check out the pinned comment below for more information, timestamps to the various parts of the video, and the sources used. e5FhRDRAZPw.title: The Fate of Stalingrad’s Civilian Population WW2
e5FhRDRAZPw.description:
As the Battle of Stalingrad raged around them, Stalingrad's civilian population was caught between two vicious regimes. Bombed, starved and murdered: the Wehrmacht terrorized and exploited the populace. The vast majority were uprooted from their homes and shipped off to the slave labour camps of the Third Reich; only a handful would survive the war. This is a brief story of the events and the fate of the Stalingraders.

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

My BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD documentary goes day by day through the battle in as much detail as possible. Check out the first video here https://youtu.be/YAfo5mse-ag

If you like Stalingrad, you may also enjoy historian Anton Joly's YouTube channel "Stalingrad Battle Data". Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIk1QDvITjPOCsIRGGpSasA

dlXqFgqOviw.title: National Socialism WAS Socialism | Rethinking WW2 History
dlXqFgqOviw.description:
Many people think that National Socialism is on the Far-Right of the political spectrum. But is this really the case? Adolf Hitler defined National Socialism as socialism; yes, he was actually a socialist. Therefore his regime was actually (technically) on the Far-Left. In this video, we will explore the ideology of one of the most evil regimes in human history and realise that we need to rethink our perception of the Eastern Front (Axis-Soviet Front) of WW2. Ultimately, what separates the Stalinist ideology from the National Socialist ideology is racism - which was central to the Nazi world view.

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

If you disagree with my definition of "Socialism" (public-sector state control of the economy/means of production) you may want to check out my more recent "Public vs Private" video, where I showed the history of the terms, starting in Ancient Greece and Rome, and moving all the way to the present day. Link https://youtu.be/ksAqr4lLA_Y

OQblCC1rh74.title: Why the Germans had the Tactical Advantage early in WW2 | Tank and Anti-Tank Warfare
OQblCC1rh74.description:
Turns out the German tactical advantage early in the war was due to a couple of simple reasons. And because they had an advantage in their tank (panzers) and their anti-tank guns, it meant that the Allies and the Soviets had a real problem early in the war. In North Africa, the British used out of date doctrines and inferior guns (like the 2-Pounder), while the Soviets had some good tanks (like the T-34), but sent them off on their own to get destroyed. Without a clear Combined Arms Doctrine, the Allies were simply at a disadvantage. But by the mid to late war, this changed, thanks mostly to the fact that the Allies and Comintern were finally able to mobilize. Yes, early German mobilization prior to WW2 is the key to this, as you will see in the video.

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

Here’s some other videos you may be interested in -

Operation Battleaxe https://youtu.be/lqGo57Drs24

Suvorov and Keitel's "Preemptive Strike" 1941 Idea https://youtu.be/TyANHGWbUHA

4 Statements the Traditional Narrative gets WRONG about WW2 German and Italian Divisions https://youtu.be/Q3RGtIpjvvw

Prokhorovka at Kursk is NOT the Biggest Tank Battle of the WW2 Eastern Front https://youtu.be/nA2286viUyw

Kampfgruppen in WW2 https://youtu.be/zKWczZkQ130

My video entitled “Why I'm Passionate about HISTORY and What Got Me Into it”
https://youtu.be/KnpCaLH9z7M

History isn’t as boring as some people think, and my goal is to get people talking about it. I also want to dispel the myths and distortions that ruin our perception of the past by asking a simple question - “But is this really the case?”. I have a 2:1 Degree in History and a passion for early 20th Century conflicts (mainly WW2). I’m therefore approaching this like I would an academic essay. Lots of sources, quotes, references and so on. Only the truth will do.

cmwogdxsUbA.title: It's NOT acceptable to DENY History | TIK Q&A 2.5
cmwogdxsUbA.description:
We have a problem. After a recent surge in far-right and far-left denialist comments in the comment sections of my videos, I've decided that the time has come to discuss these issues. People are denying events like the Holocaust, the Holodomor, or are defending either the Stalinist or the Hitler regimes for various reasons. They're also spreading distortions across the internet, trying to plant the seed of doubt in your minds. Well, their recent actions on my channel have spurred me to respond. In the future, I will be covering events like the Holocaust and Holodomor, and linking them to the wider events of WW2 and the Eastern Front. My aim will be to educate everyone so that we won't allow our understanding of history to be distorted.

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

Here’s some other videos you may be interested in -

The Alt Right Control YouTube https://youtu.be/583X6DGjits (mirror) https://youtu.be/LtHNmV-Wtbs

Behind the lies of Holocaust denial | Deborah Lipstadt https://youtu.be/0ztdofPc8Rw

Confronting Holocaust Denial: A Strategy https://youtu.be/1CLKptQmUR8

"History on Trial: My Day in Court with David Irving," Deborah Lipstadt, 9/14/2005 https://youtu.be/t7zSR7BGbuQ (note the number of downvotes)

The Origins of Mass Killing: the bloodlands hypothesis https://youtu.be/fXrqGlgufCA

What Do We Know About the Holodomor: New Research Results https://youtu.be/3k5ScxnpQrg (this video actually has timestamps!)

The MAIN Reason Why Germany Lost WW2 - OIL https://youtu.be/kVo5I0xNRhg

fV0ussbeFCE.title: Did the Russian Winter beat the Germans? And more... TIK Q&A 2
fV0ussbeFCE.description:
Many people believe that the Russian Winter stopped the Germans outside Moscow. Historians no longer think this is the case. In this video, I discuss many topics, including German logistics, Russian or Soviet sources, the Operation Barbarossa Plan, whether it was a viable strategy for the Germans to retreat to the 1941 pre-Barbarossa borders, and more! All these questions came from my Patreons who pledge $5 or more.

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

JOKAIDpOY80.title: The Myth and Reality of Joseph Stalin’s Order No. 227 “Not a Step Back!”
JOKAIDpOY80.description:
Joseph Stalin's Order 227 has led people to assume that the Red Army could only fight through intimidation. The film Enemy at the Gates is a typical example of this idea; showing the Soviets at the battle of Stalingrad to waste the lives of their men. But is this really the case? Well... no.

Yes, I said 1942 was the beginning of the war - I'm sorry about that. I keep talking about Stalingrad, and therefore I keep repeating 1942, 1942, 1942 to the point that it's become a habit. I then also didn't catch it in editing. So please forgive me for this error. The war began on the 22nd of June 1941.

Check out the pinned comment below for more information, notes, links, and sources.

Don't forget to subscribe if you like history or gaming! And hit the little bell icon to be notified when videos like this are uploaded.

Please consider supporting me on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory or SubscribeStar https://www.subscribestar.com/tikhistory and help make more videos like this possible 

This video is discussing events or concepts that are academic, educational and historical in nature. This video is for informational purposes and was created so we may better understand the past and learn from the mistakes others have made.

Q3RGtIpjvvw.title: 4 Statements the Traditional Narrative gets WRONG about WW2 German and Italian Divisions
Q3RGtIpjvvw.description:
Guderian said that the panzer divisions were weakened in 1941. Mussolini is blamed for weakening the Italian Divisions prior to WW2. The German divisions got smaller and therefore weaker as the war progressed. And the Germans could not replenish their manpower losses. Yes, there are several assumptions about division sizes and manpower which we question today. The answer to these questions may change our perspective of the Eastern Front, and of the North African Campaign. 

Check out the pinned comment below for more information, notes, links, and sources.

Don't forget to subscribe if you like history or gaming! And hit the little bell icon to be notified when videos like this are uploaded.

fr92BwihIoU.description:

ruqt8uv__18.title: Why we need a New Term for "Revisionist Historians"
ruqt8uv__18.description:
People get confused by the term 'Revisionist Historian', thinking that revising or rewriting the past could lead us down a dark and distorted path. The problem is that this confusing term actually means two things - revision of the wrong bits of the past (good), and the deliberate distortion of the past (bad). This is why we need a new term to describe the dark-side of historical revisionism. Let me explain in the video.

Check out the pinned comment below for more information, notes, links, and sources.

Don't forget to subscribe if you like history or gaming! And hit the little bell icon to be notified when videos like this are uploaded.

wDslsMgnphI.title: How BIG were Soviet Armies and Divisions in 1942? And what impact did this have?
wDslsMgnphI.description:
Red Army forces were smaller than the German equivalents during Fall Blau and Stalingrad, which had a massive impact on the Soviet generals and staff officers. This put them at a disadvantage against the Wehrmacht and added to the stress of commanders like Vasily Chuikov, commander of 62nd Army at Stalingrad. In this video we will examine why this was the case.

Check out the pinned comment below for more information, notes, links, and sources.

Don't forget to subscribe if you like history or gaming! And hit the little bell icon to be notified when videos like this are uploaded.

kVo5I0xNRhg.title: The MAIN Reason Why Germany Lost WW2 - OIL
kVo5I0xNRhg.description:
Oil was in desperately short supply for the Axis powers in WW2. One historian describes it as 'The First War for Oil' - such was the severity of the shortage. Oil was probably the biggest factor that Germany lost world war 2, and it explains many of the previous reasons why the German Wehrmacht fought the way it did.

Please see the pinned comment in the comment section for more information, including timestamps, links, additional notes, and the sources/biography I used.

Special mention goes to Richard Stokes for providing several articles for this topic. Thank you Richard!

Don't forget to subscribe if you like history or gaming! And hit the little bell icon to be notified when videos like this are uploaded.

Please consider supporting me on Patreon and help make more videos like this possible https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

As a follow up to this video, I highly recommend the Toprani video “Oil and Grand Strategy: Great Britain and Germany, 1918--1941” which can be found here - https://youtu.be/RgxEBGAXNRU

And my more recent video: Why did Synthetic OIL not solve the AXIS OIL Crisis? https://youtu.be/URBlC-wjXiQ
tags: the main reason germany lost ww2

JnWNnI6YlQQ.title: Stalin’s Purge of the Red Army and Its Effects on the WW2 Eastern Front
JnWNnI6YlQQ.description:
Did the Purge have a massive impact on the Red Army's ability to fight WW2? Historians continue to argue, and the answer may not be as clear cut as previously thought.

Military History Visualized's video on the Purges https://youtu.be/AiA8dKNcjjk

Thomas Ricks' video “Why our Generals Were More Successful in World War II” https://youtu.be/OehvY94N-WA 

Check out my other History videos here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledhMtb3bsJkJmtECxS_mm_QM

Thank you to my Patreons for helping me create this content! You guys are awesome! Help me make these videos https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

Biography -

Books:
Getty, J. Manning, R. Stalinist Terror: New Perspectives. University of Cambridge, 1993.
Guderian, H. Panzer Leader. Penguin Classics, 2000.
Hill, A. The Red Army and the Second World War. Kindle, 2017.
Liedtke, G. Enduring the Whirlwind: The German Army and the Russo-German War 1941-1943. Helion & Company, 2016.
Manstein, E. Lost Victories. Zenith Press, 1982.
Overy, R. Russia’s War. Penguin Books, 1999.
Ricks, T. The Generals: American Military Command From World War II to Today. Kindle, Penguin Group, 2013.
Service, R. Stalin: A Biography. Pan Books, 2010.
Unger, D and Unger, I. George Marshall : A Biography. Kindle.

Articles:

localized.description:
Did the Purge have a massive impact on the Red Army's ability to fight WW2? Historians continue to argue, and the answer may not be as clear cut as previously thought.

Military History Visualized's video on the Purges https://youtu.be/AiA8dKNcjjk

Thomas Ricks' video “Why our Generals Were More Successful in World War II” https://youtu.be/OehvY94N-WA 

Check out my other History videos here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledhMtb3bsJkJmtECxS_mm_QM

Thank you to my Patreons for helping me create this content! You guys are awesome! Help me make these videos https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

Biography -

Books:
Getty, J. Manning, R. Stalinist Terror: New Perspectives. University of Cambridge, 1993.
Guderian, H. Panzer Leader. Penguin Classics, 2000.
Hill, A. The Red Army and the Second World War. Kindle, 2017.

nA2286viUyw.title: Prokhorovka at Kursk is NOT the Biggest Tank Battle of the WW2 Eastern Front
nA2286viUyw.description:
It turns out that Prokhorovka is not the biggest tank battle of WW2, or of all time. Instead, that title goes to Brody-Dunbo in 1941. In this video we'll look at the numbers, and also the only English source that's dedicated to the battle.

The David Glantz quote can be found here in his "The Soviet-German War, 1941-1945: Myths and Realities" VIDEO https://youtu.be/5qkmO7tm8AU?t=15m54s

Jack of War's video on Brody https://youtu.be/PVLoH8S4quo

And if you'd like to help me make more videos like this, please support me on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

Subscribe if you like history or gaming! Click this link to subscribe!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

Sources used in this video:
Glantz, D. Operation Barbarossa: Hitler’s Invasion of Russia 1941. Kindle edition.
Glantz, D. When Titan’s Clashed. University Press of Kansas, 2015.
Isaev, A. Dubno 1941. The Greatest Tank Battle of the Second World War. Helion & Company, 2017.
Healy, M. Zitadelle: The German Offensive Against the Kursk Salient 4-17 July 1943. Kindle edition, 2016.

B-ZHH770WLs.title: Your Perception of the WW2 Eastern Front is Wrong
B-ZHH770WLs.description:
The prevalent view is that the German Army wasn’t really beaten by the Red Army on the battlefield, at least not on the tactical or operational level. It's also thought that the German Army was vastly outnumbered. But is this view correct? Perhaps it's time to change your view on the Wehrmacht.

GLANTZ VIDEO "The Soviet-German War, 1941-1945: Myths and Realities" by COL (Ret) David M. Glantz https://youtu.be/5qkmO7tm8AU

Main source used: Liedtke, G. “Enduring the Whirlwind: The German Army and the Russo-German War 1941-1943.” Helion & Company, 2016.

Check out my other History videos here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledhMtb3bsJkJmtECxS_mm_QM

Support me on Patreon https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

bVbqdD6CmOI.title: CROATIAN LEGION | 369th Reinforced (Croatian) Infantry Regiment WW2
bVbqdD6CmOI.description:
The Croatian Legion fought on the Eastern Front of WW2, and was the only non-German Axis unit to fight at the Battle of Stalingrad. They were part of the 100th Jäger Division, itself the only jäger division to fight at Stalingrad. This video details the history of the 369th Reinforced (Croatian) Infantry Division, although I will be covering the units actions at Stalingrad in my upcoming Stalingrad documentary.

The Croatian Legion makes a return in my more recent documentary series, BATTLESTORM STALINGRAD, where we go day by day through the entire battle in as much detail as possible. You can view the first video of the series here https://youtu.be/YAfo5mse-ag

Also, check out my other BATTLESTORM Documentary videos - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledgHIszXQVDreX-ZC1Xejf9Y

This video is part of a new series called "Their Story", where we look at people, units, events, and other interesting historical things. Check out the series here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledj8I6pKBa8amXLJMtFcLSqs

Subscribe if you like history or gaming! Click this link to subscribe!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

Consider supporting me on Patreon and make more videos like this possible! https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

And finally, the source and book itself - Jason D. Mark and Amir Obhođaš. "Croatian Legion: The 369th Reinforced (Croatian) Infantry Regiment on the Eastern Front 1941-1943." Leaping Horsemen Books, 2010. http://www.leapinghorseman.com/proddetail.php?prod=9780975107683&cat=5

This is NOT a sponsored video.

8aEVQwRpKIY.title: MANNERHEIM | History and his Line
8aEVQwRpKIY.description:
Carl Gustav Emil Mannerheim towers over all other characters of the Winter War, and of Finnish history in general. This video is a brief introduction to one of the great leaders of the 20th Century (and according to a TV poll in 2004, the greatest Finn of all time). lqGo57Drs24.title: The REAL Operation Battleaxe 1941 | BATTLESTORM WW2 Documentary
lqGo57Drs24.description:
Looking for the most in-depth look at Operation Battleaxe? We cover the tank battle, the combat at the Hellfire Pass (Halfaya) the units of the Afrika Korps and the Desert Rats, and learn the roles and fate of the commanders on both sides during this epic battle. Battleaxe is an incredibly important battle that has massive tactical and strategic implications for both sides of World War II. Yet this is a battle unknown to many, and not very well documented. Today, we change that.
 
Using animations and detailed maps, let's find out what happened in one of the most crucial battles in the North African Campaign of World War II.
 
Check out my other Battlestorm Videos!
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledgHIszXQVDreX-ZC1Xejf9Y
 
Subscribe if you like history or gaming! Click this link to subscribe!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight
 
And please consider supporting me on Patreon if you want to see more videos like this https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

efY-KnqrI-0.title: How I Get a LOT of Work Done... And How You Can Too
efY-KnqrI-0.description:
Do you struggle to write essays and do research?

Today I'm going to give you three tips that will make you more productive.

My TIKhistory series is all about HISTORY and showing you the progress I'm making behind the scenes for my upcoming BATTLESTORM Documentaries. Check out the playlist here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledhpvGA5suvZusGG1EjsLlWj

Subscribe if you like history or gaming! Click this link to subscribe!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

Help me make my Stalingrad Documentary (and other BATTLESTROM Docs) the best it can be - https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

*Slight miscalculation when I added the words for Baker's comment. I'd actually done slightly more than I said I did in his original comment, so the numbers are out. Without going into all the numbers, I'm basically working at around 27.7 WPM, which is still 2,000+ words a day (although not quite as fast as mentioned in the video). I'm going to be recording my output per day going forwards so I can monitor my performance and give you some hard numbers in the future.

Fn0VamsaJzk.title: Open Mindedness
Fn0VamsaJzk.description:
Being open minded is a critical skill in life. For people who study history, it's super important. How can we discover the truth if we're closed to other people's ideas? And whether we think they're right or wrong, we should weigh up their arguments and be prepared to change our own viewpoints.

jAv3vNGeEZQ.title: Language Barriers and History
jAv3vNGeEZQ.description:
If we can't communicate, we're stuck. Historians face this issue all the time. Thank you to InDisguise for this question. If you have any other questions, let me know!

LLwSUfbXO5E.title: History... Nobody Knows
LLwSUfbXO5E.description:
Some things we will never know, despite all our attempts to figure them out. There are parts of history that are beyond our reach. Even the popular histories have gaps, let alone the unknown ones. And its a real shame because if we can't figure out exactly what happened in the popular histories, what are the lesser known histories going to be like...?

Subscribe if you like history or gaming! Click this link to subscribe!

HFmwj4YzjlY.title: Forgotten Battles of History
HFmwj4YzjlY.description:
Some battles aren't popular. And yet they had a massive impact on world history. One such battle is the Battle of Warsaw in 1920. Have you read Adam Zamoyski's book? Personally, I really enjoyed "Warsaw 1920", and highly recommend it.

What forgotten battles do you know? Let me know in the comments. And if you have any recommendations for history books, I'm all ears. Obviously, I'm still making my BATTLESTORM Stalingrad documentary, and that takes priority, but I do have time to read other things, so let me know.

And yes, I have a lot of history books. History books to the moon!  If you haven't seen the video where I show you a few of my many history books, check it out here https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aPhAnk_3u1U&list=PLNSNgGzaledhpvGA5suvZusGG1EjsLlWj&index=1

ydqN2Zi3DYg.title: RETREAT! Documentary on the Long Range Desert Group | Part 4 BATTLESTORM
ydqN2Zi3DYg.description:
Detailing Mitford's A Squadron in their retreat and battles around Mechili 1941. We look at Long Range Desert Group using graphics and historical references, let's take a look at the "men who made the SAS" in this BATTLESTORM-LIKE history documentary.


Video on Rommel's FIRST Battle in the North African Campaign (goes into detail about the battle around Mechili)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wMv9YN11xkY

BATTLESTORM Master Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledgHIszXQVDreX-ZC1Xejf9Y

Sources:
Morgan, M. The Sting of the Scorpion: The Inside Story of the Long Range Desert Group. The History Press, 2011.
Mortimer, G. The Men Who Made the SAS: The History of the Long Range Desert Group. Constable, 2015.
Owen, D. Providence Their Guide: The Long Range Desert Group 1940-45. Pen & Sword Militart, 2008.
Playfair, I. History of The Second World War: United Kingdom Military Series. The Mediterranean And Middle East. Volume 1: Early Successes against Italy [to May 1941]. The Naval & Military Press Ltd, 2004.

---

UGxODQR6GS0.title: OPERATION BREVITY | BATTLESTORM Documentary | WW2 Tank Battle in the North African Desert
UGxODQR6GS0.description:
Looking for the most in-depth look at Operation Brevity? Using animations and detailed maps, let's find out what happened during this WW2 Tank Battle in the North African Desert in 1941. Brigadier 'Strafer' Gott leads his first independant command against the German and Italian forces around Fort Cupuzzo and Bardia. But General Rommel has a man on the ground who can stop him... Colonel Herff.

Check out my other Battlestorm Videos!
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledgHIszXQVDreX-ZC1Xejf9Y

Subscribe if you like history or gaming! Click this link to subscribe!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

Sources:

Beevor, Antony. The Second World War. Phoenix, 2014. (Does Mention Brevity, but no details)
Bierman, J. & Smith, C. Alamein: War Without Hate. Penguin Books Ltd, 2003.
Butler, Daniel Allen. Field Marshal: the Life and Death of Erwin Rommel. Casemate Publishers, 2015.
Dimbleby, J. Destiny in the Desert. The Road to El Alamein - the Battle that Turned the Tide. Profile Books Ltd, 2013. (doesn’t even mention Brevity - proves how unknown this battle is)
Hart, Liddell. A History of the Second World War. Pan Books, 2015. Kindle version.
Mitcham, S. Rommel’s Desert War: The Life and Death of the Afrika Korps. Stackpole Books, 2007.
Neillands, R. Eighth Army, From the Western Desert to the Alps, 1939-1945. John Murray Publishers, 2004.
Nash, N. Strafer Desert General : The Life and Killing of Lieutenant General WHE Gott. Pen and Sword Books Ltd, 2013.
Neillands, R. The Desert Rats, 7th Armoured Division 1940-45. Aurum Press Limited, 2005.
Pitt, B. The Crucible of War: Wavell’s Command. The Definitive History of the Desert War. Cassell & Co, 2001.
Playfair, I. The Mediterranean and Middle East, Volume II, The Germans come to the Help of their Ally [1941]. The Naval & Military Press LTD, 1956.
Raugh, H. Wavell in the Middle East 1939-1941: A Study in Generalship. USA, 2013.
Williamson, Gordon. Afrikakorps 1941-43 (Elite). Osprey Publishing, 2009. (Barely mentions Brevity)

IFP4-dwTMQ0.title: The REAL Fort Eben Emael | BATTLESTORM Documentary
IFP4-dwTMQ0.description:
Looking for the most in-depth look at the Battle of Fort Eben Emael? Using animations and detailed maps, let's find out what happened... On May 10th 1940, gliders of Sturmgruppe Granit land on the greatest fortress in the world. Despite being outnumbered 10 to 1, the Fallschirmjager are victorious and the door to Belgium is smashed open. This video describes the event in as much detail as possible.

Check out my other Battlestorm Videos!
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledgHIszXQVDreX-ZC1Xejf9Y

English subtitles provided.
This video took around 6 months to make. Animation, script and music all created by TIK.

Sources:
Beever, A. The Second World War. Kindle.
Dunstan, S. Fort Eben Emael: The Key to Hitler’s Victory in the West. Osprey Publishing.
Gukeisen, T. The Fall of Fort Eben Emael: The Effects of Emerging Technologies on the Successful Completion of Military Objectives. Pickle Partners Publishing, 2014.
McNab, C. The Fall of Eben Emael: Belgium 1940.
Saunders, Tim. Fort Eben Emael 1940. Pen and Sword Books, 2005.
Shirer, W. The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich. 1960.

jBv9SzVOxHU.description:
Detailing Bagnold's attack on Murzuk, let's look at the exploits of the Long Range Desert Group between November 1940 and January 1941. Also detailed is the French at Chad under French commanders Colonel d’Ornano and Colonel Leclerc, as well as the battle at Jebel Sherif 1941 with the Italian Auto-Saharan Company.

k_xy7RCm5Ho.title: Somaliland 1940 | BATTLESTORM-LITE Documentary
k_xy7RCm5Ho.description:
Italy invades British Somaliland in August 1940 shortly after joining the war. As part of the East African Campaign, General Nasi leads an overwhelming force of Italian colonial and irregular banda against the small British Camel Corps and co. Wavell sends General Godwin-Austin to lead the British forces. The Battle of Tug Argan decides the fate of British Somaliland.

BATTLESTORM is a WW2 History documentary series aiming to explain battles and campaigns using 3D animation in as much detail as possible.
BATTLESTORM-LITE aims to do the same but with 2D animations and fewer sources (due to time restraints).

All research, music, narration and animations created by TIK.

Source used in this episode:
Playfair, I. History of The Second World War: United Kingdom Military Series. The Mediterranean And Middle East. Volume 1: Early Successes against Italy [to May 1941]. The Naval & Military Press Ltd, 2004.

Subscribe if you like history or gaming! Click this link to subscribe!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

_ETldINcrTQ.title: Did Churchill create the Desert Fox? History Debate
_ETldINcrTQ.description:
Churchill's decision to go to Greece and pull forces from the Western Desert meant that General O'Connor couldn't advance to Tripoli. The result was that the Desert Fox was able to land and forge his place in history. Could things have been different?

Support this channel by subscribing!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

Also, if you haven't done already, follow me on Twitter!
https://twitter.com/TIKhistory

Dimbleby, Jonathan. Destiny in the Desert: The Road to El Alamein - the Battle that Turned the Tide. Great Britain, 2012.
Jorgensen, Christer. Afrika Korps: Rommel’s 1941 Offensive (Rapid Reads). Brown Bear Books, 2014.
Moorehead, Alan. The Desert War: the Classic Trilogy on the North Africa Campaign 1940-43. CPI Group, 2012.
Pitt, Barrie. The Crucible of War: Volume 1: Wavell’s Command. Cassell & Co, 2001.
Playfair. The Mediterranean and Middle East Volume 1: Early Successes against Italy [to May 1941]. 1954. 
Playfair, Major-General I.S.O. The Mediterranean and Middle East, Volume II, “The Germans come to the help of their Ally” (1941). The Naval & Military Press Ltd, 2004.
Thompson, Dennis H. Discarded Victory - North Africa, 1940-1941. Pickle Partners, 2014.

wMv9YN11xkY.title: The Desert Fox | Rommel's FIRST Battle in the North African Campaign | BATTLESTORM
wMv9YN11xkY.description:
Erwin Rommel faces the might of the British Empire. In 3D animation, we'll see the units, the battlefield and the tactics The Desert Fox uses to overcome the British and Australian forces at Mersa Brega and throw them out of Italian Libya. Except for Tobruk of course! The video covers Erwin Rommel's arrival in Italian Libya up to the beginning part of the Battle of Tobruk 1941.

This video is Part 2 of the Western Desert Campaign - Part 1 (Operation Compass) is in the link below
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b71kdhj27rk

My BATTLESTORM videos (in order) Playlist -
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledgHIszXQVDreX-ZC1Xejf9Y

Subscribe to get notified when future BattleStorm videos come out!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

Also, if you haven't done already, follow me on Twitter!
https://twitter.com/TIKhistory

b71kdhj27rk.title: Operation Compass 1940-41 | BATTLESTORM North African Campaign Documentary
b71kdhj27rk.description:
The most in-depth look at Operation Compass out there! Using animations and detailed maps, let's find out what happened in one of the greatest British (and Commonwealth) victories of the war and who was responsible for the destruction of the Italian 10th Army. This video covers the start of the North African Campaign up to the Battle of Beda Fomm.

SUBSCRIBE!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

My Market Garden Documentary
https://youtu.be/vTUC79o4Kmc

My Twitter
https://twitter.com/TIKhistory

Sources:
Barnett, C. The Desert Generals. Weidenfeld & Nicolson, 2011.
Bierwirth, J. Beda Fomm: An Operational Analysis. Pickle Partners, 1994.
Christie H. Fallen Eagles: The Italian 10th Army in the Opening Campaign in the Western Desert, June 1940. Pickle Partners 1999.
Dimbleby, J. Destiny in the Desert. Britain 2013. 
Moorehead, A. The Desert War: The Classic Trilogy on the North Africa Campaign 1940-43. Aurum Press, 2014. 
Playfair. The Mediterranean and Middle East Volume 1: Early Successes against Italy [to May 1941]. 1954. 
Wahlert, G. The Western Desert Campaign. Australia, 2011 

Music is my own!

vTUC79o4Kmc.title: The REAL Operation Market Garden | BATTLESTORM Documentary | All Episodes
vTUC79o4Kmc.description:
Looking for the most in-depth look at Operation Market Garden? Using animations and detailed maps, let's find out what happened and who was to blame for the failure at Arnhem, Nijmegen and Eindhoven. Was the plan really doomed to fail from the start? Was it really "A Bridge Too Far"? Let's find out.

I originally created this series as 8 separate videos. This video is all episodes of my series in one video for your viewing pleasure.

Check out my other Battlestorm Videos!
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledgHIszXQVDreX-ZC1Xejf9Y

Don't forget to subscribe if you like history or gaming! And hit the little bell icon to be notified when videos like this are uploaded.

Please consider supporting me on Patreon and help make more videos like this possible https://www.patreon.com/TIKhistory

Sources:
John Frost, A Drop Too Many. 2009.
Max Hastings, Armageddon. London, 2004. 
Robert J. Kershaw, It Never Snows in September. Surry, 2007. 
Martin Middlebrook, Arnhem 1944: The Airborne Battle, 17-29 September. 2009.
Robert Neillands, The Battle for the Rhine 1944. UK, 2014.
Poulussen, R.G. Lost at Nijmegen. 2011.
Cornelius Ryan, A Bridge Too Far. USA, 1974 
Major General R E Urquhart, Arnhem. 1958. 
Major General S Sosabowski, Freely I Served. Great Britain, 1982. 

Music used:
Battle of Kings by Per Kiilstofte https://machinimasound.com/music/battle-of-kings/
Cloister of Redemption by Jens Kiilstofte https://machinimasound.com/music/cloister-of-redemption/
Damnation by Jens Kiilstofte https://machinimasound.com/music/damnation/
Escape from the Temple by Per Kiilstofte https://machinimasound.com/music/escape-from-the-temple/
Incursion by Per Kiilstofte https://machinimasound.com/music/incursion/
Rallying the Defense by Per Kiilstofte https://machinimasound.com/music/rallying-the-defense/
Seeking Loot by Aaron Spencer https://machinimasound.com/music/seeking-loot/

Another attempt to get to Frost at Arnhem bridge by 1st Airborne goes in on this day... Will it succeed? General Roy Urquhart doesn't think so.

SUBSCRIBE!
http://www.youtube.com/subscription_center?add_user=theimperatorknight

Sources:
John Frost, A Drop Too Many. 2009.
Max Hastings, Armageddon. London, 2004.
Robert J. Kershaw, It Never Snows in September. Surry, 2007. 
Martin Middlebrook, Arnhem 1944: The Airborne Battle, 17-29 September. 2009.
Robert Neillands, The Battle for the Rhine 1944. UK, 2014. 
Poulussen, R.G. Lost at Nijmegen. 2011.
Cornelius Ryan, A Bridge Too Far. USA, 1974 
Major General R E Urquhart, Arnhem. 1958. 
Major General S Sosabowski, Freely I Served. Great Britain, 1982. 

Music used:
Battle of Kings by Per Kiilstofte https://machinimasound.com/music/battle-of-kings/

QlFvGkeFSCo.title: Most Produced German Armoured Fighting Vehicle of World War 2??? QUESTION OF THE DAY #38 Quiz
QlFvGkeFSCo.description:
* SPOILER and CORRECTION * Due to me misreading the info, I got this wrong! (see, I will admit my mistakes). PzIII chassis production was more than any other, but technically, it was the StuG III that was the most produced German AFV

What was the Most Produced German Armoured Fighting Vehicle of World War 2? Comment below and let us know! Answers at the end!

QOTD - a daily quiz

Don't forget to check out my other questions! https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNSNgGzaledjwP_u_TB_Bpjs0ZqWu2R86
